# Council of Ministers <orig>مجلس الوزراء</orig>
## Decree-Law No. 69 of 2025
### Amending Some Provisions of Law No. 2 of 2016
#### Regarding the Establishment of the Public Anti-Corruption Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة لمكافحة الفساد</orig> and Provisions for Financial Disclosure

- After reviewing the Constitution <orig>الدستور</orig>,
- And the Amiri Order <orig>الأمر الأميري</orig> issued on 2 Dhu al-Qi'dah 1445 AH corresponding to May 10, 2024,
- And the Penal Code <orig>قانون الجزاء</orig> issued by Law No. (16) of 1960, and its amending laws,
- And the Code of Criminal Procedure and Trials <orig>قانون الإجراءات والمحاكمات الجزائية</orig> issued by Law No. (17) of 1960, and its amending laws,
- And Law No. (24) of 1962 regarding Clubs and Public Benefit Associations <orig>جمعيات النفع العام</orig>,
- And Decree-Law No. (24) of 1979 regarding Cooperative Societies <orig>الجمعيات التعاونية</orig>, and its amending laws,
- And Decree-Law No. (23) of 1990 regarding the Law on the Organization of the Judiciary <orig>قانون تنظيم القضاء</orig>, and its amending laws,
- And Law No. (20) of 2014 regarding Electronic Transactions <orig>المعاملات الإلكترونية</orig>,
- And Law No. (2) of 2016 regarding the Establishment of the Public Anti-Corruption Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة لمكافحة الفساد</orig> and Provisions for Financial Disclosure,
- And the Bankruptcy Law <orig>قانون الإفلاس</orig> issued by Law No. (71) of 2020,
- And Decree No. 84 of 2024 regarding Ministerial Substitutions and Delegations <orig>الحلول والإنابات الوزارية</orig> and its amending decrees,
- And upon the submission of the Minister of Justice <orig>وزير العدل</orig>,
- And after the approval of the Council of Ministers <orig>مجلس الوزراء</orig>,
- We have issued the following Decree-Law:

(Article One)
The texts of Articles (1, 2, 5 item 2, 9, 14, 32 item 2, and 45 first paragraph) of the aforementioned Law No. (2) of 2016 shall be replaced with the following texts:

### Article (1)
For the purposes of applying the provisions of this Law, the words and phrases listed below shall have the meaning indicated next to each, unless the context of the text requires otherwise:
- The Authority: The Public Anti-Corruption Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة لمكافحة الفساد</orig>.
- The Competent Minister: The Minister of Justice <orig>وزير العدل</orig>.
- The Council: The Board of Directors of the Authority.
- The President: The President of the Authority, and the Chairman of the Council.
- The Convention: The United Nations Convention Against Corruption <orig>اتفاقية الأمم المتحدة لمكافحة الفساد</orig>.
- Illicit Gain <orig>الكسب غير المشروع</orig>: Any increase in wealth or decrease in liabilities that occurs – due to holding office or status – to a person subject to this Law, or their minor children, or anyone for whom they are a guardian, custodian, or trustee, when it is disproportionate to their resources and unjustified.
- Public Official <orig>الموظف العام</orig>: Anyone holding a civilian or military position in governmental bodies, regardless of the nature of their work or job title, or anyone considered a public official among the persons stipulated in Article (43) of the aforementioned Penal Code <orig>قانون الجزاء</orig>.
- Financial Disclosure <orig>الذمة المالية</orig>: All monetary, real estate, or movable assets, inside and outside Kuwait, belonging to a person subject to the provisions of this Law, their minor children, and anyone for whom they are a guardian, custodian, or trustee. This includes their rights and their debts to third parties, as well as agencies or authorizations with financial effect issued by them to others or by others in their favor, and usufruct rights.
- Report <orig>البلاغ</orig>: Information or notification submitted to the Authority by a natural or legal person containing information about the occurrence of a corruption crime, an attempt to commit it, concealment of its commission, disposal of its evidence, tools, or proceeds, or the commission of a serious financial violation.
- Reporter <orig>المبلغ</orig>: The person who reports any corruption crime, and this applies to witnesses, victims of the crime, and experts who provide testimony related to criminalized corruption incidents.
- Proceeds of Corruption <orig>متحصلات الفساد</orig>: Properties and assets of all kinds, movable and immovable, tangible and intangible, and any benefits and returns resulting therefrom, obtained by any person directly or indirectly as a result of committing a corruption crime, including legal documents and papers that prove ownership of such properties and assets or prove the rights associated therewith.

### Article (2)
The provisions of this Law shall apply to the following categories:
1. The Prime Minister <orig>رئيس مجلس الوزراء</orig>, Deputy Prime Minister <orig>نائب رئيس مجلس الوزراء</orig>, Ministers <orig>الوزراء</orig>, and anyone holding an executive position with the rank of Minister.
2. The Speaker <orig>رئيس مجلس الأمة</orig>, Deputy Speaker <orig>نائب رئيس مجلس الأمة</orig>, and members of the National Assembly <orig>مجلس الأمة</orig>.
3. The President <orig>رئيس المجلس الأعلى للقضاء</orig> and members of the Supreme Judicial Council <orig>المجلس الأعلى للقضاء</orig>, the President <orig>رئيس المحكمة الدستورية</orig> and advisors of the Constitutional Court <orig>المحكمة الدستورية</orig>, advisors of the Court of Cassation <orig>محكمة التمييز</orig> and the Court of Appeal <orig>محكمة الاستئناف</orig>, judges <orig>القضاة</orig>, members of the Public Prosecution <orig>النيابة العامة</orig>, and the Head <orig>رئيس إدارة الفتوى والتشريع</orig> and members of the Fatwa and Legislation Department <orig>إدارة الفتوى والتشريع</orig>.
4. The Director General <orig>المدير العام</orig> and members of both the General Department of Investigations <orig>الإدارة العامة للتحقيقات</orig> in the Ministry of Interior <orig>وزارة الداخلية</orig> and the Legal Department <orig>الإدارة القانونية</orig> in Kuwait Municipality <orig>بلدية الكويت</orig>.

16. Directors and Deputy Directors, technical inspectors, members of the Legal Department, and anyone with judicial enforcement authority in the General Administration of Customs <orig>الإدارة العامة للجمارك</orig>.

### Article (5) Clause (2):
Detecting, monitoring, and tracking corruption crimes, apprehending acts, incidents, and violations of financial and administrative corruption, receiving reports, complaints, and information about corruption crimes and acts, incidents, and violations of financial and administrative corruption, taking necessary measures to investigate them, conducting preliminary inquiries, hearing statements regarding them, studying them, and taking legally required actions to either dismiss them or refer them to the competent investigative authority.

### Article (6)
The Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig> shall have a Board of Directors <orig>مجلس إدارة</orig> consisting of five full-time members, whose appointment shall be by a decree based on the nomination of the competent minister for a term of four years, renewable once. The decree shall designate the Chairman and his Deputy from among them. Members must possess integrity, experience, and competence in fields related to the Authority's work. If the position of Chairman, Deputy Chairman, or any Board member becomes vacant for any reason, a replacement shall be appointed using the same appointment procedures, and the new member shall complete only the remainder of their predecessor's term.

### Article (9)
If the Chairman, Deputy Chairman, or any member of the Board commits a serious breach of their duties, the competent minister – after the approval of the Supreme Judicial Council <orig>المجلس الأعلى للقضاء</orig> – shall issue a decision to form a judicial committee <orig>لجنة قضائية</orig> composed of three advisors from the Court of Cassation <orig>محكمة التمييز</orig> or the Court of Appeal <orig>محكمة الاستئناف</orig>, chaired by the most senior among them, to investigate the breach. The committee shall submit a reasoned report on its work to the competent minister within two months, concluding either with the termination of the membership of the investigated person or the dismissal of the case.

### Article (14)
The Chairman shall issue a decision specifying the employees of the Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig> who are responsible for detecting and monitoring corruption crimes, apprehending incidents, acts, and violations of financial and administrative corruption, conducting preliminary inquiries, collecting statements, gathering evidence and information, obtaining relevant papers and documents, and preparing the necessary reports in accordance with the provisions of this law, preparatory to referring them to the competent investigative authority. This decision shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

### Article (32) Clause (2):
(2) Updating the declaration within sixty days from the end of every four years, as long as they remain in any of the positions subject to the provisions of this chapter.

### Article (45) First Paragraph:
Anyone who violates the provisions of Articles (15, 16, 29, 34) repeated of this law shall be punished by imprisonment for a period not exceeding three years and a fine of not less than two thousand dinars <orig>دينار</orig> and not exceeding ten thousand dinars <orig>دينار</orig>, or by one of these two penalties.

5. Arbitrators and experts at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>, technical liquidators, members of the administration and trustees stipulated in the aforementioned Bankruptcy Law <orig>قانون الإفلاس</orig>, and notaries and public scribes in the Real Estate Registration and Notarization Sector <orig>قطاع التسجيل العقاري والتوثيق</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
6. Chairman, Deputy Chairman, and members of the Municipal Council <orig>المجلس البلدي</orig>.
7. Chairmen and members of councils, authorities, and committees that undertake executive tasks and whose formation or appointment of members is issued by a law, decree, or decision from the Council of Ministers <orig>مجلس الوزراء</orig>.
8. Chairman of the Financial Controllers Authority <orig>جهاز المراقبين الماليين</orig>, his deputies, heads of sectors within the Authority, and financial controllers.
9. Leaders, who are:
- Occupants of the leadership job group in the general salary scale (Excellent Grade / Undersecretary / Assistant Undersecretary).
- Members of Boards of Directors, Directors General and their deputies or assistants, and Secretaries General and their deputies or assistants in public authorities or institutions or any government entity.
- Those considered leaders, such as chairmen of authorities and their deputies, or administrative units, or delegated members in public authorities and institutions.
- Directors of departments and those considered equivalent, such as heads of organizational units approved in their structures at the level of a department or higher.
The provision of the preceding two clauses applies to military personnel, diplomats, and civilians in ministries, government departments, public authorities and institutions, and entities with independent or autonomous budgets, whenever they assume the responsibilities or enjoy the benefits prescribed for the position, whether their occupation of the position is original or temporary. The Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig>, in coordination with the relevant authorities, shall periodically identify and update the occupants of these positions subject to the provisions of this law.
10. Chairman, Deputy Chairman, Board members, Secretary General, Assistant Secretaries, Directors, and technical staff of the Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig>.
11. Chairman, Deputy Chairman, Undersecretaries, Directors, and technical staff of the State Audit Bureau <orig>ديوان المحاسبة</orig>.
12. State representatives in the membership of boards of directors of companies in which the State, a government entity, public authority, public institution, or other public legal entity directly contributes a share of not less than 25% of the capital.
13. Members of boards of directors of cooperative societies <orig>الجمعيات التعاونية</orig>, their financial and administrative controllers, and sports authorities and clubs.
14. Chairmen of boards of directors and members of charitable and civil societies <orig>الجمعيات الخيرية والأهلية</orig>, and their executive directors.
15. Members of the Legal Department in each of the Public Institution for Social Security <orig>المؤسسات العامة للتأمينات الاجتماعية</orig>, the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig>, the Insurance Regulatory Unit <orig>وحدة تنظيم التأمين</orig>, and the Competition Protection Agency <orig>جهاز حماية المنافسة</orig>.

### Article (41 bis):
The Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig> is prohibited from disclosing the identity and data of the informant unless judicial procedures require otherwise, or based on prior written consent from the informant.
### Article (46 bis):
The Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig> may reconcile in crimes related to the delay in submitting financial disclosure <orig>الذمة المالية</orig> if the required declaration is submitted within ninety days following the expiry of the period necessary for submitting the declaration or upon notification, as the case may be.
Reconciliation shall be in exchange for payment of an amount of 100 Dinars <orig>دينار</orig>.
Reconciliation shall result in the non-initiation of criminal proceedings.
### Article (56 bis):
The Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig> shall follow any of the following methods for serving documents related to the application of the provisions of this Law and its Executive Regulations <orig>لائحته التنفيذية</orig>:
1.  Serving judicial documents by electronic notification or by process servers.
2.  A registered letter with acknowledgment of receipt via mail or delivery by a person authorized by the Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig>.
3.  Any means consistent with the provisions of applicable laws.

## (Article Three)
The word (Council <orig>المجلس</orig>) shall be replaced by the phrase (Board of Trustees <orig>مجلس الأمناء</orig>), and the word (Chairman <orig>الرئيس</orig>) shall be replaced by the phrases (Head of the Authority <orig>رئيس الهيئة</orig>, and Chairman of the Board of Trustees <orig>رئيس مجلس الأمناء</orig>) wherever they appear in the texts of the articles of Law No. (2) of 2016 referred to.

## (Article Four)
Any provision that contradicts the provisions of this Decree-Law <orig>مرسوم بقانون</orig> shall be repealed.

## (Article Five)
Ministers – each within their respective jurisdiction – shall implement this Decree-Law <orig>مرسوم بقانون</orig>, and it shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> and come into force from the date of its publication.

## (Article Two)
A new clause numbered (13) shall be added to Article (22), and a final paragraph to Article (27) of Law No. (2) of 2016 referred to, and new articles shall also be added to this Law numbered (9 bis, 29 bis, 29 bis (a), 32 bis, 34 bis, 41 bis, 46 bis, and 56 bis), the texts of which are as follows:
### Article (22) Clause (13):
13- Crimes stipulated in Decree-Law <orig>مرسوم بقانون</orig> No. (24) of 1979 regarding Cooperative Societies <orig>الجمعيات التعاونية</orig>.
### Article (27) Second Paragraph:
Without prejudice to the provisions of Article (9) of the Law of Criminal Procedures and Trials <orig>قانون الإجراءات والمحاكمات الجزائية</orig> referred to, the Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig> may undertake the necessary investigative actions and hear statements to ascertain the seriousness of reports received or facts of financial and administrative corruption it uncovers, in preparation for taking the appropriate decision regarding their disposition, whether by archiving them or referring them to the competent investigative authority.
### Article (9 bis):
The Public Prosecution <orig>النيابة العامة</orig> alone shall be competent to investigate, dispose of, and prosecute crimes committed by the Chairman and members of the Council <orig>المجلس</orig> or any employee of the Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig> due to or in connection with the performance of their duties, provided that the Public Prosecution <orig>النيابة العامة</orig> shall notify the Council <orig>المجلس</orig> in advance of the investigation dates and the measures it has taken regarding the person under investigation.
### Article (29 bis):
The Council <orig>المجلس</orig> shall issue a reasoned decision by a majority of its members to archive the report submitted to the Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig> if it finds that the conditions for its submission have not been met, otherwise, it shall refer it to the competent investigative authority.
The archiving decision shall not be binding on that authority regarding the investigative procedures it deems appropriate to take.
### Article (29 bis (a)):
The Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig> has the right to appeal decisions issued by the competent investigative authorities to archive reports referred by it, in accordance with legally prescribed deadlines and procedures.
### Article (32 bis):
Subject to the provisions of Law No. (20) of 2014 referred to, the subject <orig>الخاصع</orig> may deposit their financial disclosure <orig>إقرار ذمته المالية</orig> and any other documents requested by the Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig> in the form of an electronic document accompanied by their accredited electronic signature, by any modern electronic communication means capable of storage and retrieval in accordance with the rules and controls specified by the Executive Regulations <orig>اللائحة التنفيذية</orig> of this Law.
### Article (34 bis):

# Decree-Law No. 70 of 2025

Concerning the Repeal of the Text of Articles (159 and 182)
of the Penal Code <orig>قانون الجزاء</orig> issued
by Law No. 16 of 1960

- Having reviewed the Constitution,
- And on the Amiri Order <orig>الأمر الأميري</orig> issued on 2 Dhu al-Qi'dah 1445 AH, corresponding to
10 May 2024 AD,
- And on the Penal Code <orig>قانون الجزاء</orig> issued by Law No. 16 of 1960, and its amending laws,
- And on Decree No. 84 of 2024 regarding Ministerial Substitutions and Delegations <orig>الحلول والإنابات الوزارية</orig> and its amending decrees,
- And based on the submission of the Minister of Justice,
- And after the approval of the Council of Ministers <orig>مجلس الوزراء</orig>,
- We have issued the following Decree-Law <orig>مرسوم بقانون</orig>:

## (Article One)

The text of Articles (159 and 182) of the aforementioned Penal Code <orig>قانون الجزاء</orig> shall be repealed.

# Explanatory Memorandum <orig>المذكرة الإيضاحية</orig>
## Regarding Decree-Law No. 69 of 2025
Amending Certain Provisions of Law No. 2 of 2016
Concerning the Establishment of the Public Anti-Corruption Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة لمكافحة الفساد</orig>
and Provisions Related to Financial Disclosure <orig>الكشف عن الذمة المالية</orig>

In the context of enhancing the system of transparency and integrity and supporting national efforts aimed at combating corruption, this Decree-Law <orig>مرسوم بقانون</orig> comes as an amendment to certain provisions of Law No. (2) of 2016 concerning the establishment of the Public Anti-Corruption Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة لمكافحة الفساد</orig> and provisions related to financial disclosure <orig>الكشف عن الذمة المالية</orig>, to address gaps arising from the practical application of its provisions and to align with new developments.
The Decree has included new categories under the umbrella of the Law's provisions, thereby enhancing the comprehensiveness of anti-corruption efforts, in addition to including crimes stipulated in Decree-Law No. (24) of 1979 concerning Cooperative Societies <orig>الجمعيات التعاونية</orig> among corruption crimes.
This Decree has deemed it appropriate to establish a new formation for the Council, naming it the Authority's Board of Directors <orig>مجلس إدارة الهيئة</orig>, consisting of five members, including the Chairman, his Deputy, and three full-time members.
This Decree has entrusted the Authority's Board of Directors <orig>مجلس إدارة الهيئة</orig> with the jurisdiction to dismiss complaints submitted to the Authority if they are found not to meet the submission conditions, by a reasoned decision <orig>قرار مسبب</orig> with the majority of members, while affirming the Authority's right to appeal decisions by the investigating authority <orig>جهة التحقيق</orig> to dismiss complaints.
It was also deemed appropriate to stipulate that the identity and data of the informant <orig>المبلغ</orig> shall not be disclosed except to the competent investigating authorities <orig>جهات التحقيق المختصة</orig> upon their request, or with the written approval of the Authority, along with the introduction of a provision allowing the Authority to accept financial disclosure statements <orig>إقرارات الذمة المالية</orig> submitted in the form of an electronic document.
To provide the necessary guarantees for the Authority's employees, the Decree has granted the Public Prosecution <orig>النيابة العامة</orig> exclusive jurisdiction to investigate, dispose of, and prosecute incidents committed by the Authority's employees during or due to the performance of their duties, while ensuring that the Authority's Board of Directors <orig>مجلس إدارة الهيئة</orig> is notified of investigation dates and procedures taken.
This Decree has introduced the possibility of accepting reconciliation <orig>الصلح</orig> in crimes of delay in submitting financial disclosure statements <orig>إقرارات الذمة المالية</orig> if the person subject to the provisions of this Law initiates the submission of the statement within the specified period and pays the determined amount, which achieves flexibility without prejudice to the principles of justice.
<page_end>5</page_end>

# Explanatory Memorandum
## Regarding Law-Decree No. 70 of 2025
## Repealing the Text of Articles (159 and 182)
### Of the Penal Code <orig>قانون الجزاء</orig> issued by Law No. 16 of 1960

Stemming from the constitutional principles guaranteed by the Constitution of the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> in protecting motherhood and childhood, caring for the youth and protecting them from exploitation and neglect, and in implementation of the international obligations adopted by the State through its ratification of conventions and agreements concerned with child rights, it has become necessary to repeal the text of Article (159) of the Penal Code <orig>قانون الجزاء</orig> issued by Law No. (16) of 1960, regarding the mitigating legal excuse provided by this text for a mother who kills her newborn immediately after birth to avoid shame.

The necessity of this repeal is based on several justifications, including the conflict of the aforementioned Article (159) with the principles established by the Constitution of the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, especially what Article (9) thereof stipulates: (The family is the foundation of society; its pillars are religion, morality, and love of the homeland. The law preserves its entity, strengthens its bonds, and protects motherhood and childhood under its umbrella), and what Article (10) of the Constitution <orig>الدستور</orig> stipulates: (The State is committed to caring for the youth and protecting them from exploitation, and safeguarding them from moral, physical, and spiritual neglect), given that the right to life is the basis of all other rights that are linked to it in existence and non-existence. This principle is affirmed by Islamic Sharia <orig>الشريعة الإسلامية</orig> in the words of Allah Almighty in verses (8, 9) of Surat At-Takwir <orig>سورة التكوير</orig> (And when the girl buried alive is asked, for what sin she was killed), and His saying, Exalted be He, in verse (31) of Surat Al-Isra <orig>سورة الإسراء</orig> (And do not kill your children for fear of poverty. We provide for you and for them).

Furthermore, other considerations related to the repeal of the aforementioned Article (159) of the Penal Code <orig>قانون الجزاء</orig> are in line with the international obligations of the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> under the Convention on the Rights of the Child of 1989, which the State ratified by Law No. (104) of 1991, especially what this Convention stipulated in its Article Six: (States Parties recognize that every child has the inherent right to life) and States Parties shall ensure to the maximum extent possible the survival and development of the child, and what was stated in the Arab Charter on the Rights of the Child of 1983, which the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> approved by Law No. (36) of 1993, and which emphasized the necessity of providing the highest degree of legal protection for children from all forms of violence and neglect.

For all these reasons, it has become clear that the continued application of Article (159) of the aforementioned Penal Code <orig>قانون الجزاء</orig>, by allowing an unjustified exception in mitigating punishment for crimes targeting a child's life, contradicts the constitutional principles and international obligations as previously explained.

And stemming from the same established constitutional principles guaranteed by the Constitution of the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> in protecting rights and freedoms, ensuring justice and equality among members of society, and in implementation of the international obligations adopted by the State through its ratification of conventions concerned with combating violence against women, it has also become imperative and necessary to repeal the text of Article (182) of the aforementioned Penal Code <orig>قانون الجزاء</orig>, which stipulated the exemption of a kidnapper from punishment if he marries the person he kidnapped, due to the explicit contradiction of this article's ruling with the provisions of the Constitution <orig>الدستور</orig>, established legal principles, and relevant international conventions.

This contradiction is represented by the conflict of Article (182) of the aforementioned Penal Code <orig>قانون الجزاء</orig> with Article (29) of the Constitution <orig>الدستور</orig>, which stipulates that (People are equal in human dignity, and they are equal before the law in public rights and duties, with no discrimination among them in this regard due to sex, origin, language, or religion). The aforementioned Article (182) allows an unjustified advantage for the perpetrator to escape punishment merely by marrying the victim, which creates legal discrimination that harms women's rights and undermines the principle of equality before the law.

Furthermore, this constitutes a blatant violation of the victim's rights and perpetuates a culture of impunity, which necessitates its repeal to ensure the alignment of national legislation with constitutional values and criminal justice, as it has become clear that its continued application provides an unjustified legal cover for perpetrators.

And since the Amiri Order <orig>الأمر الأميري</orig> was issued on 2024/5/10, and Article (4) thereof stipulated that laws shall be issued by law-decrees, a draft of the similar law-decree was prepared, and its first article stipulated the repeal of the text of Articles (159 and 182) of the aforementioned Penal Code <orig>قانون الجزاء</orig>. And it was issued as:

# Constitutional Court <orig>المحكمة الدستورية</orig>
## Advisory Chamber <orig>غرفة المشورة</orig>
At the session held by the Court in the Advisory Chamber <orig>غرفة المشورة</orig> on 16 Dhu al-Qi'dah 1446 AH, corresponding to May 14, 2025 AD
Presided over by His Excellency Counselor <orig>المستشار</orig> / Adel Ali Al-Bahouh <orig>عادل علي البحوه</orig>, President of the Court <orig>رئيس المحكمة</orig>
And with the membership of Their Excellencies Counselors <orig>المستشارين</orig> /
Saleh Khalifa Al-Murshed <orig>صالح خليفه المرشد</orig> and Abdul Rahman Mishari Al-Darmi <orig>عبد الرحمن مشاري الدارمي</orig>
and Ibrahim Abdul Rahman Al-Saif <orig>ابراهيم عبد الرحمن السيف</orig> and Walid Ibrahim Al-Moajel <orig>وليد إبراهيم المعجل</orig>
And in the presence of Mr. / Yousef Ahmed Ma'rafi <orig>يوسف أحمد معرفي</orig>, Session Secretary <orig>أمين سر الجلسة</orig>
The following decision was issued:
In the Direct Appeal / Advisory Chamber <orig>غرفة المشورة</orig>
Registered in the Court's register under number (1) for the year 2025
Filed by: Yaqoub Yusuf Ali Al-Marbani <orig>يعقوب يوسف علي المربني</orig>
The Court <orig>المحكمة</orig>
After reviewing the documents and deliberation.
Whereas the appellant challenged the unconstitutionality of the second paragraph of Article (14) of Law No. (1) of 1993 concerning the Protection of Public Funds <orig>حماية الأموال العامة</orig>, which punishes a public employee <orig>الموظف العام</orig> if, through their error, they cause serious harm to the funds or interests of the entity they work for or are connected with by virtue of their position, and if the grave error committed by them resulted in damage to the country's financial, commercial, or economic conditions, or to any national interest thereof, the appellant argued that this text violated the principle of legality of crime and punishment <orig>شرعية الجريمة والعقوبة</orig> as its wording was undefined and unclear, capable of bearing more than one meaning, in a way that could lead to multiple interpretations regarding the concept and limits of grave error <orig>الخطأ الجسيم</orig> and serious harm <orig>الضرر الجسيم</orig>, which constitutes a violation of personal liberty <orig>الحرية الشخصية</orig> guaranteed by Article (30) of the Constitution <orig>الدستور</orig>.
The appellant also challenged the unconstitutionality of the first paragraph of Article (20) of the same law, which did not permit the application of Article (81) in any case to any of the crimes mentioned in this law unless the perpetrator promptly returned the full funds subject of the crime before the closing of pleadings <orig>إقفال باب المرافعة</orig> in cases where restitution is mandatory, as it thereby established an unjustified distinction between perpetrators of intentional crimes against public funds <orig>الاعتداء على المال العام</orig> who are obliged to make restitution, in which case Article (81) may be applied to them, and those not obliged to make restitution, in violation of the principles of justice, equality, and equal opportunities <orig>العدالة والمساواة وتكافؤ الفرص</orig>, in addition to its breach of the fair and equitable trial <orig>المحاكمة العادلة المنصفة</orig> standards stipulated in Articles (7), (8), (29), (34), and (163) of the Constitution <orig>الدستور</orig>.
The appellant also challenged Article (21 bis) <orig>21 مكرراً</orig> of the same law, which stipulated that criminal proceedings <orig>الدعوى الجزائية</orig> for crimes stipulated in this law shall not lapse by prescription <orig>بمضي المدة</orig>, thereby depriving perpetrators of unintentional grave error <orig>الخطأ الجسيم غير العمدي</orig> crimes from the prescription of their criminal actions, despite the fact that intentional and unintentional crimes in all laws are subject to the periods of prescription stipulated by law, which violates the principle of equality <orig>مبدأ المساواة</orig> stipulated in Article (29) of the Constitution <orig>الدستور</orig>.

the entity for which he works, and he was convicted by a final judgment that is not subject to review or appeal. Therefore, a ruling on the unconstitutionality of that text – assuming the validity of the appellant's claim regarding preventing the judge from exercising his discretionary power to decide not to pronounce punishment – will not have an effect on the judgment issued convicting him, as long as it does not extend to removing the text of criminalization itself. Consequently, it will not result in his retrial for the same act again, as he remains responsible for the error committed and for compensating the damages incurred by his employer because of it. Thus, he does not have a direct personal interest in the appeal. And since the appellant, in the similar appeal, re-directed the same appeal to the text of the two aforementioned articles, the basis for accepting his appeal is lacking. Nor does it benefit him to subsequently add an appeal against Article (21 bis) <orig>21 مكرراً</orig> of the Law, which stipulated that criminal proceedings for crimes stipulated in this law shall not lapse by prescription. It is inconceivable to consider the prescription of criminal proceedings after a final judgment of conviction has been issued and executed. Furthermore, this prescription has no relation to the compensation claim filed by his employer to demand compensation for the damages he caused, which relies on the provisions of tort liability. Therefore, he also does not have a direct personal interest in appealing this article. Nor does the argument that he still suffers from the moral and ethical effects of the judgment issued convicting him change this, as a legally recognized interest cannot be merely a theoretical interest, aiming solely to annul the challenged texts in an abstract manner. Rather, the appellant must derive a direct benefit from requesting their annulment, which makes it appropriate to rule on the inadmissibility of the appeal and the confiscation of the guarantee.
Therefore,
the Court – in the consultation chamber – decided to dismiss the appeal and confiscate the guarantee.

The appellant added that he had a direct personal interest in filing the present appeal due to the issuance of a final criminal judgment convicting him under the aforementioned challenged texts, despite their unconstitutionality. This resulted in damages, represented by a claim for compensation from the administrative entity for which he worked, under lawsuit No. (8027) of 2019, Civil General Government/14, and its appeal No. (3913) of 2023, Commercial Civil Government/10, and the issuance of a judgment obliging him to pay substantial financial amounts as compensation. The cassation appeal against that judgment, No. (1268) of 2024 Civil, has not yet been decided to date. And that a ruling on the unconstitutionality of those articles would render them null and void, thus making them unsuitable as a basis for claiming compensation. Furthermore, the judgment issued convicting him resulted in his deprivation from working in his financial specialization, which affects his career future.
Given that, and as stipulated in Article (4 bis) <orig>الرابعة مكرراً</orig> – added by Law No. (109) of 2014 to the Law Establishing the Constitutional Court <orig>قانون إنشاء المحكمة الدستورية</orig> No. (14) of 1973 – although the legislator permitted any natural or legal person to file an appeal by direct claim before this Court – against any law, decree-law, or regulation – the legislator explicitly required in the text of this article that the appellant must have a direct personal interest, without which the appeal is inadmissible. This means that the legislative text alleged to violate the Constitution must have caused harm to the appellant as a result of its application to him, or that the probability of harm to him is high, such that a ruling on its unconstitutionality would remove this harm and achieve a benefit for him. Furthermore, the legislator required that the appeal be serious as an indispensable condition for its acceptance, and this Court may investigate this matter. If it finds that the appeal is not serious, it shall decide – in the consultation chamber – to dismiss it.
In light of the foregoing, and as this Court previously concluded in its decision issued by the consultation chamber on 10/7/2024 in direct appeal No. (5) of 2024 – filed by the appellant himself – that the phrases in the second paragraph of the challenged Article (14) were "clear and explicit, without ambiguity or obscurity, as they openly state the forms of error required therein, the damages that may befall the employer because of it, and the penalty prescribed for these acts. It is not a defect in the text to leave it to the judge to assess the gravity of this error or the damages resulting from it in light of the material facts presented before him. Thus, the text does not violate the aforementioned articles of the Constitution." The Court also affirmed in the same decision that the appeal against the first paragraph of Article (20) of the Law does not achieve a significant interest for the appellant that would distinguish his right to file an appeal against it, as this appeal relates to the prescribed penalty and the judge's authority to decide not to pronounce punishment. It has been established that the accusation attributed to the appellant has been settled due to his error in causing serious damage to the funds of

Whereas the appellant company challenged the unconstitutionality of Clause (First / B) of Executive Rule No. (28) of the Executive Rules and Instructions for Kuwaiti Income Tax Decree No. (3) of 1955, as amended by Law No. (2) of 2008, issued by Administrative Decision No. (875) of 2013 by the Assistant Undersecretary for Financial and Tax Affairs, insofar as it stipulated that the costs and expenses of subcontractor works should not exceed the revenues of these works for them to be deductible from taxable income, in violation of Article (3) of the Income Tax Decree, which mandated the deduction of all expenses and costs incurred to generate taxable income, and Article (3) of the Executive Regulations of Law No. (2) of 2008, which specified the conditions for allowable expenses and costs deductible from taxable income, limiting these conditions to being necessary for generating income from the activity, being genuine and supported by documents, and relating to the taxable period. Thus, the challenged text has added a condition not found in the law or its executive regulations, which renders it unconstitutional for violating the principle of separation of powers, the principle that no tax may be established or amended except by law, and the principle that laws and regulations may not be applied retroactively, as stipulated in Articles (50), (51), (72), (73), (134), and (179) of the Constitution, in addition to the illegitimacy of that text for violating an effective and applicable legal provision. The appellant had a direct personal interest in filing the present appeal, as tax was assessed against it for the financial years ending on 31/12/2013 and 31/12/2014, and the deduction of costs and expenses for subcontractor works from taxable income was disallowed in accordance with the aforementioned executive rule. Consequently, it challenged the tax assessment, and the dispute between it and the Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig> in this regard is still pending before the judiciary, which prompted it to file this appeal.

It was established, in accordance with Article (Fourth bis) – added by virtue of Law No. (109) of 2014 to the Law Establishing the Constitutional Court <orig>الحكمة الدستورية</orig> No. (14) of 1973 – that while the legislator permitted any natural or legal person to file a direct claim before this Court <orig>الحكمة</orig> challenging any law, decree-law, or regulation, the legislator explicitly required in the text of this article that the appeal must be serious as an indispensable condition for its acceptance. This Court <orig>الحكمة</orig> may investigate this matter, and this Court <orig>الحكمة</orig> may investigate this matter. If it finds that the appeal is not serious or falls outside its jurisdiction, it shall decide – in chambers – to dismiss it.

Given this, and since the grounds for the appeal primarily concerned the violation by the challenged text, from the Executive Rules and Instructions for the Kuwaiti Income Tax Decree, of the law under which it was issued, due to the law not including the condition it stipulated for deducting expenses and costs related to subcontractor works from taxable income, and given that the aforementioned text did not involve the establishment of a new tax or its amendment, and the jurisprudence of this Court <orig>الحكمة</orig> has established that the subject of judicial review it exercises regarding the constitutionality of regulations is based on a conflict between a provision therein and a provision in the Constitution. If the challenged decision suffers from a defect of illegality, then this defect is considered related to its legality, sufficient alone to request its annulment before the Administrative Circuit <orig>الدائرة الإدارية</orig>, which has become solely competent to annul administrative decisions that violate laws since the issuance of Decree-Law No. (20) of 1981 establishing a circuit within the Court of First Instance <orig>الحكمة الكلية</orig> to hear administrative disputes, as amended by Law No. (61) of 1982, as the Administrative Circuit <orig>الدائرة الإدارية</orig> must, before applying any regulatory provision, ascertain its legality and conformity with the law. Consequently, the challenged text falls outside the scope of judicial review exercised by the Constitutional Court <orig>الحكمة الدستورية</orig>, and it is appropriate to rule on the inadmissibility of the appeal and the forfeiture of the bond.

Therefore,
The Court <orig>الحكمة</orig> – in chambers – decided to dismiss the appeal and forfeit the bond.

# Consultation Chamber

At the session held by the Court in the Consultation Chamber on 16 Dhu al-Qi'dah 1446 AH, corresponding to May 14, 2025 AD
Presided over by His Excellency Counselor / Adel Ali Al-Jawah <orig>عادل علي الجوه</orig>, President of the Court
And with the membership of Their Excellencies Counselors /
Saleh Khalifa Al-Murshid <orig>صالح خليفه المرشد</orig> and Abdul Rahman Mishari Al-Dari <orig>عبد الرحمن مشاري الداري</orig>
and Ibrahim Abdul Rahman Al-Saif <orig>إبراهيم عبد الرحمن السيف</orig> and Waleed Ibrahim Al-Moajel <orig>وليد إبراهيم المعجل</orig>
And in the presence of Mr. / Yousef Ahmed Ma'rafi <orig>يوسف أحمد معرفي</orig>, Session Secretary
The following decision was issued:
Regarding the Direct Appeal / Consultation Chamber
Registered in the Court's register under number (3) for the year 2025
Filed by: Inverted House Coffee Shop Company <orig>شركة كوفي شوب البيت المقلوب لتقديم المشروبات</orig> for Beverage Services
The Court
After reviewing the documents and deliberation,
Whereas the appellant company challenged the unconstitutionality of the decision of the Minister of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزير التجارة والصناعة</orig> No. (227) for the year 2024 regarding the amendment of Decision No. (27) for the year 2015 issuing the executive regulations of Law No. (39) for the year 2014 concerning consumer protection, specifically regarding the addition of Article (40 bis) to the regulations, which authorized the Undersecretary of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وكيل وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> to issue a decision granting exclusive and comprehensive licenses to companies or establishments approved by the competent official authorities, to undertake the organization of major national events and celebrations, the appellant arguing that this article contained provisions not included in Law No. (39) for the year 2014 concerning consumer protection, and were not necessary for its implementation, and involved an amendment to its provisions, as the law regulated how to obtain a license to conduct temporary discounts or special offers on prices of goods displayed to the public without differentiation among those addressed by its provisions, while the challenged ministerial decision allowed the granting of exclusive licenses to specific companies to the exclusion of others, in violation of the provisions of this law, and also violated Articles (7) and (8) of the Constitution, as it restricted the organization and conduct of special offers and discounts to the company exclusively licensed for that purpose, and compelled other companies to submit to it and join it in this matter, which contradicts the principles of equality and equal opportunities. The appellant had a direct personal interest in filing the present appeal, as, based on the challenged decision, the Undersecretary of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وكيل وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> issued a decision granting one of the companies licensed by the Ministry an exclusive license to organize the Kuwait Shopping Festivals <orig>مهرجانات الكويت للتسوق</orig> in 2025, thereby depriving the appellant of the opportunity to apply for a license for that purpose, which prompted it to file the present appeal.
It is established, in accordance with Article (4 bis) – added by virtue of Law No. (109) for the year 2014 to the Law establishing the Constitutional Court <orig>المحكمة الدستورية</orig> No. (14) for the year 1973 – that while the legislator permitted any natural or legal person to file a direct appeal before this Court against any law, decree-law, or regulation, the legislator explicitly stipulated in this article that seriousness in the appeal is an indispensable condition for its acceptance, and this Court may investigate this matter, and if it finds that the appeal is not serious or falls outside its jurisdiction, it shall decide – in the Consultation Chamber – its inadmissibility.
Given this, and as the jurisprudence of this Court has settled that equality before the law is achieved by the fulfillment of the conditions of generality and abstraction in the legal rule, and it is clear that the challenged decision permitted the granting of exclusive and comprehensive licenses to companies or establishments approved by the competent official authorities, to undertake the organization of major national events and celebrations, by virtue of a general, abstract rule applicable to all those addressed by its provisions without any differentiation or discrimination among them, therefore, the claim of its violation of the principle of equality and equal opportunities is unfounded, and the matter in this regard reverts to how companies are selected for such licensing, which is a matter related to the application of the text and thus falls outside the scope of this Court's oversight.
As for the argument regarding the challenged decision's violation of the law under which it was issued, the jurisprudence of this Court has settled that the judicial oversight it exercises concerning the constitutionality of regulations is predicated on a conflict between a provision therein and a provision in the Constitution, so if the challenged decision suffers from a defect of violating the law, then this defect is considered related to its legality, sufficient alone to request its annulment before the Administrative Circuit <orig>الدائرة الإدارية</orig>, which has become solely competent to annul administrative decisions that violate laws since the issuance of Decree-Law No. (20) for the year 1981 establishing a circuit within the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> to hear administrative disputes, amended by Law No. (61) for the year 1982, as the Administrative Circuit must, before applying any regulatory text, verify its legality and conformity with the law, and therefore the challenged decision falls outside the scope of judicial oversight exercised by the Constitutional Court <orig>المحكمة الدستورية</orig>, and it is appropriate to rule the appeal inadmissible and confiscate the bond.
Therefore,
The Court – in the Consultation Chamber – decided to dismiss the appeal as inadmissible and confiscate the bond.
<footer>
Session Secretary
President of the Court
</footer>

# Consultation Chamber

At the session held by the Court in the Consultation Chamber on 16 Dhu al-Qi'dah 1446 AH corresponding to May 14, 2025 AD
Presided over by His Excellency Counselor / Adel Ali Al-Bahwa <orig>عادل علي البحوه</orig>, President of the Court
And with the membership of Their Excellencies Counselors /
Saleh Khalifa Al-Murayshid <orig>صالح خليفه المريشد</orig> and Abdul Rahman Mishari Al-Darmi <orig>عبد الرحمن مشاري الدارمي</orig>
And Ibrahim Abdul Rahman Al-Saif <orig>إبراهيم عبد الرحمن السيف</orig> and Waleed Ibrahim Al-Moajel <orig>وليد إبراهيم المعجل</orig>
And in the presence of Mr. / Yousef Ahmed Ma'rafi <orig>يوسف أحمد معرفي</orig>, Session Secretary
The following decision was issued:
Regarding the Direct Appeal / Consultation Chamber
Registered in the Court's register under number (16) for the year 2024
Filed by: Jamal Essa Ibrahim Al-Hafez <orig>جمال عيسى إبراهيم الحافظ</orig>
The Court

After reviewing the documents and deliberation.

Whereas the appellant challenged the unconstitutionality of Article (3) of Law No. (88) of 1995 regarding the trial of ministers, concerning its provision for the formation of an investigation committee composed of three Kuwaiti <orig>كويتيين</orig> counselors from the Court of Appeal <orig>محكمة الاستئناف</orig>, specialized in examining submitted complaints and possessing all legally prescribed powers of investigation authorities. This challenge was based on its alleged violation of Article (167) of the Constitution, which stipulates that the Public Prosecution <orig>النيابة العامة</orig> shall undertake public prosecution on behalf of society, with the only exception being what it permits security authorities to undertake public prosecution in misdemeanors according to the procedures specified by law. The appellant had a direct personal interest in filing the present appeal, as a decision was issued on 5/8/2024 by the aforementioned committee to seize all his cash, movable assets, and real estate, and to prevent him from disposing of them, in connection with the investigation in Case No. (2) for the year 2024, concerning the investigation of ministers, despite him not being investigated or charged with any offense therein, which prompted him to file the present appeal.

It was established, in accordance with Article (Fourth bis) – added by virtue of Law No. (109) of 2014 to the Law establishing the Constitutional Court <orig>المحكمة الدستورية</orig> No. (14) of 1973 – that while the legislator permitted any natural or legal person to file a direct appeal before this Court against any law, decree-law, or regulation, the legislator explicitly stipulated in this article that seriousness in the appeal is an indispensable condition for its acceptance. This Court has the discretion to investigate this matter, and if it finds the appeal to be not serious, it shall decide – in the Consultation Chamber <orig>غرفة المشورة</orig> – its inadmissibility.

Given the foregoing, and since Article (132) of the Constitution entrusted the legislator with issuing a special law defining crimes committed by ministers in the performance of their duties, and outlining the procedures for their accusation, trial, and the manner of such trial, in response to this constitutional directive, the legislator issued Law No. (88) of 1995 regarding the trial of ministers. This law specified the body competent to try ministers as a special court composed of five Kuwaiti <orig>كويتيين</orig> counselors from the Court of Appeal <orig>محكمة الاستئناف</orig>. Due to the specificity and importance of the crimes falling under the jurisdiction of that court, the legislator deemed it appropriate – pursuant to the text of Article (3) of the aforementioned and challenged law – that a special investigation committee, composed of three Kuwaiti <orig>كويتيين</orig> counselors from the Court of Appeal <orig>محكمة الاستئناف</orig>, should undertake the preliminary investigation and investigation work in these cases. This is in compliance with Article (132) of the aforementioned Constitution, which authorized the legislator to determine the accusation procedures for these crimes. Thus, this committee was assigned the task of examining submitted complaints in this regard and taking any necessary action required by such examination, possessing all legally prescribed powers of investigation authorities. The law did not overlook the role of the Public Prosecution <orig>النيابة العامة</orig> in public prosecution, as it mandated the presence of a Public Prosecution member, whose rank is not less than that of a Chief Prosecutor <orig>رئيس نيابة</orig>, at investigation sessions to express any requests they deem appropriate. It also stipulated that the Public Prosecution <orig>النيابة العامة</orig> is responsible for undertaking the prosecution before the Court. Therefore, the claim of unconstitutionality of the challenged text for violating Article (167) of the Constitution is unfounded, which means that the seriousness required for the present appeal is not met, and thus it is appropriate to rule its inadmissibility and confiscate the bail.

Therefore,
The Court – in the Consultation Chamber <orig>غرفة المشورة</orig> – decided to dismiss the appeal and confiscate the bail.

Session Secretary
President of the Court

# Ministry of Social Affairs <orig>وزارة الشؤون الاجتماعية</orig>
## Ministerial Resolution No. (59) of 2025 AD
### Regarding the Amendment of the Articles of Association of the Kuwait Bar Association <orig>جمعية المحامين الكويتية</orig>

Minister of Social Affairs <orig>وزير الشؤون الاجتماعية</orig> and Family and Childhood Affairs
- After reviewing Law No. (24) of (1962 AD) regarding Clubs and Public Benefit Societies <orig>جمعيات النفع العام</orig> and its amendments.
- And on Decree No. (50) of (2017 AD) regarding the Ministry of Social Affairs <orig>وزارة الشؤون الاجتماعية</orig>.
- And on Ministerial Resolution No. (61) of (2005 AD) regarding the Model Articles of Association for Public Benefit Societies <orig>جمعيات النفع العام</orig>.
- And on Ministerial Resolution No. (1/8) of (1962) regarding the declaration of the Kuwait Bar Association <orig>جمعية المحامين الكويتية</orig>.
- And on the minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly meeting held on 9/3/2025 to amend the Society's Articles of Association in accordance with the model.
- And on the approval of the Committee for the Declaration, Evaluation, and Dissolution of Public Benefit Societies <orig>جمعيات النفع العام</orig> and Endowments <orig>المبرات</orig>, and the Study and Review of their Articles of Association, in its meeting No. (21/2024) held on (16/10/2024 AD).
- And on the memorandum of the Assistant Undersecretary for Social Development <orig>الوكيل المساعد للتنمية الاجتماعية</orig> dated (19/3/2025 AD).
- And after the presentation by Mr. / Undersecretary of the Ministry.
- And based on what the public interest <orig>المصلحة العامة</orig> dictates
((Resolved))
**Article (1):**
Amendment of the Articles of Association of the Kuwait Bar Association <orig>جمعية المحامين الكويتية</orig> in accordance with the Model Articles of Association.
**Article (2):**
Amendment of Article (4) of the Society's Articles of Association by adding conditions for an active member, which are (every lawyer whose name is registered in the General Register of Lawyers).
**Article (3):**
Amendment of Article (36) to read as follows: (The affairs of the Society shall be managed by a Board of Directors consisting of eleven members elected by the General Assembly).
**Article (4):**
Addition of the following text to Article No. (37): It is a condition for anyone nominating themselves for membership in the Board of Directors to be an active member, to have the right to attend the General Assembly, and to be registered in the register of lawyers accepted to plead before the Court of Appeal.
**Article (5):**
The provisions of this Resolution shall be effective from the date of its publication in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>, and the competent authorities shall be informed and implement its contents.

# Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig>
## Ministerial Resolution No. (3) of 2025
Regarding the Formation of a Committee to Manage the Affairs of the Trade Union Organization <orig>المنظمة النقابية</orig>
In the Event of the Absence of a Board of Directors <orig>مجلس إدارة</orig>
First Deputy Prime Minister, Minister of Interior, and Chairman of the Board of Directors of
the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig>:
- Having reviewed Law No. 6 of 2010 concerning Labor in the Private Sector <orig>قانون العمل في القطاع الأهلي</orig> and its amendments,
- And Law No. 109 of 2013 concerning the Establishment of the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig>,
- And Decree No. (153) of 2022 transferring the Supervision of the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig>,
- And the international agreements related to trade union freedom <orig>الحرية النقابية</orig>, especially Convention No. (87) of 1948,
- And the Regulations for Organizing Trade Union Work <orig>لائحة تنظيم العمل النقابي</orig> issued pursuant to Administrative Resolution No. (1470) of 2015,
- And based on what the interest of work, the public interest <orig>المصلحة العامة</orig>, and the stability of trade union organizations <orig>المنظمات النقابية</orig> and employers' organizations <orig>منظمات أصحاب الأعمال</orig> dictate,
We have decided

### Article (1):
The competent Minister <orig>الوزير المختص</orig> shall issue a resolution to form a temporary committee <orig>لجنة مؤقتة</orig> to manage the affairs of the concerned organization until new elections are held in accordance with the provisions of the law and regulating regulations. This shall apply in the event of judicial rulings leading to the complete or partial dissolution of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس إدارة</orig> of the trade union organization <orig>المنظمة النقابية</orig>, or in the event of a dispute arising between employers' and workers' organizations <orig>منظمات أصحاب الأعمال والعمال</orig> or within any of those organizations or between them, or for any other reason that has led to the organization's inability to perform its duties or crippled its ability to continue exercising its trade union activities.

# Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig>
## Ministerial Resolution No. (37) of 2025
Regarding the Authorization of the Kuwait Investment Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للاستثمار</orig>
and the Central Bank of Kuwait <orig>بنك الكويت المركزي</orig>
to Execute Borrowing on Behalf of the Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig>
The Minister of Finance <orig>وزير المالية</orig> and Minister of State for Economic Affairs and Investment <orig>وزير الدولة للشئون الاقتصادية والاستثمار</orig>,
Having reviewed:
- Law No. (32) of 1968 regarding Currency, the Central Bank of Kuwait <orig>بنك الكويت المركزي</orig>, and the Regulation of the Banking Profession, and its amending laws,
- And Decree-Law No. (31) of 1978 regarding the Rules for Preparing Public Budgets, Monitoring their Implementation, and the Final Account,
- And Law No. (47) of 1982 establishing the Kuwait Investment Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للاستثمار</orig>,
- And Ministerial Resolution No. (19) of 2016 regarding the Establishment of the Public Debt Management Committee,
- And Ministerial Resolution No. (32) of 2016 regarding the Establishment of the Public Debt Department,
- And Decree-Law No. (60) of 2025 regarding Finance and Liquidity,
- And the Public Debt Strategy and the approved Financing Plan for the fiscal year 2025/2026.
Has decided
### (Article One)
The Central Bank of Kuwait <orig>بنك الكويت المركزي</orig> is authorized, on behalf of the Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig>, in coordination and consultation with the Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig>, to execute borrowing operations in Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> or major convertible foreign currencies within the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>, in accordance with the recognized financial methods and instruments in this regard.
### (Article Two)
The Kuwait Investment Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للاستثمار</orig> is authorized, on behalf of the Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig>, in coordination and consultation with the Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig>, to execute borrowing operations in major convertible foreign currencies from the global market, in accordance with the recognized financial methods and instruments in this regard.
### (Article Three)
Officials – each within their respective scope – shall implement this resolution and periodically inform the Minister of Finance <orig>وزير المالية</orig> of the measures taken in accordance with its provisions. It shall be effective from the date of its issuance and published in the Official Gazette.

## Resolution No. (95) of 2025
Regarding the renewal of a collective investment scheme license;

**Having reviewed:**
- Law No. (7) of 2010 regarding the establishment of the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> and the regulation of securities activities, its executive regulations, and their amendments;
- And the collective investment scheme license certificate for Baytak Capital Money Market Fund in Kuwaiti Dinar <orig>صندوق بيتك كابيتال لأسواق النقد بالدينار الكويتي</orig> No. (LCIS/2019/0001) issued on 18/08/2022;
- And the request from Baytak Capital Investment Company <orig>شركة بيتك كابيتال للاستثمار</orig> to renew the license of Baytak Capital Money Market Fund in Kuwaiti Dinar <orig>صندوق بيتك كابيتال لأسواق النقد بالدينار الكويتي</orig>;
- And based on Resolution No. (04) of 2025 regarding the amendment of final approval authorities for the operational procedures of the Supervision Sector, issued on 12/01/2025.

**Has resolved the following:**

## Article One:
The collective investment scheme license for Baytak Capital Money Market Fund in Kuwaiti Dinar <orig>صندوق بيتك كابيتال لأسواق النقد بالدينار الكويتي</orig> shall be renewed for a period of three years, renewable, effective from 18/08/2025.

## Article Two:
The competent authorities shall implement this resolution, each within its jurisdiction. It shall be effective from its date of issuance and published in the Official Gazette.

Head of the Supervision Sector
Ziyad Yaqoub Yousef Al-Fulaij <orig>زياد يعقوب يوسف الفليج</orig>
Issued on: 21 May 2025

## Article (3):
The interim committee shall undertake the following tasks:
- Managing urgent administrative and financial matters of the organization to ensure its continued performance of its basic functions.
- Receiving prescribed subscriptions from the organization's members.
- Preparing and updating lists of the names of General Assembly members who meet the conditions for membership and voting rights.
- Issuing invitations for an electoral General Assembly meeting within the period specified for the committee's work.
- Supervising nomination procedures and election procedures in accordance with the provisions of the Labor Law, the Trade Union Work Regulation Bylaw, and the organization's internal regulations.

## Article (4):
The committee shall prepare a detailed report of all its work, which shall be presented to the first General Assembly for approval, and a copy thereof shall be submitted to the competent Minister.

## Article (5):
This resolution shall be effective from its date of issuance and published in the Official Gazette.

First Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Interior
Fahad Yousef Saud Al-Sabah <orig>فهد يوسف سعود الصباح</orig>

- And on Law No. 56 of 1966 regarding the issuance of the Industry Law <orig>قانون الصناعة</orig>, its executive regulations, and their amendments.
- And on Decree-Law No. 128 of 1977 regarding Standardization <orig>التوحيد القياسي</orig>.
- And on the internal regulations approved by the Ministerial Committee for Standardization Affairs <orig>اللجنة الوزارية لشؤون التقييس</orig> on November 14, 2019, which supersedes the basic statute of the Standardization Organization for the Gulf Cooperation Council (GCC) States <orig>هيئة التقييس لدول مجلس التعاون لدول الخليج العربية</orig>.
- And on the relevant ministerial decisions concerning the adoption of Kuwaiti technical regulations and standard specifications.
- And on the recommendation contained in the minutes of the fifth meeting of the National Permanent Committee for the Electrical and Electronic Specifications Sector <orig>اللجنة الوطنية الدائمة لقطاع المواصفات الكهربائية والإلكترونية</orig> held on December 17, 2019.
- And on the recommendation contained in the minutes of the ninth meeting of the National Permanent Committee for the Electrical and Electronic Specifications Sector <orig>اللجنة الوطنية الدائمة لقطاع المواصفات الكهربائية والإلكترونية</orig> held on December 7, 2022.
- And on the decision of the General Standardization Committee <orig>اللجنة العامة للتوحيد القياسي</orig> at its sixty-ninth meeting held on December 18, 2022.
- And on Ministerial Decision No. 2023/16 regarding the adoption of four (4) mandatory Kuwaiti technical regulations.
- And on Ministerial Decision No. 2024/24 regarding the implementation of four (4) mandatory Kuwaiti technical regulations.
- And based on the presentation of the Acting Director General of the Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig>.
- And based on what the public interest dictates.

## Decision
### Article One
Article One of Ministerial Decision No. 224/24 regarding the implementation of four (4) mandatory Kuwaiti technical regulations shall be amended, whereby the technical requirements contained in the Kuwaiti Technical Regulation "Rotating Electrical Machines - Efficiency Classifications of AC Motors" No. KWS 1897:2023 shall commence implementation from March 1, 2026, while the provisions of Decision 2024/24 regarding the implementation of four (4) mandatory Kuwaiti technical regulations shall continue to apply to the remaining technical regulations mentioned in Article One thereof (and annexed to this Decision).

### Article Two
All previous decisions regarding the adoption of Kuwaiti technical regulations and standard specifications that conflict with this Decision shall be repealed.

### Article Three
This Decision shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> and shall come into force according to Article One.

Issued on: May 22, 2025 AD

Minister of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزير التجارة والصناعة</orig>
Khalifa Abdullah Al-Ajeel <orig>خليفة عبد الله العجيل</orig>

6- Life Insurance Products: These are insurance policies whose purpose is to pay specific amounts due to death, disability, reaching a certain age, or upon the expiry of the agreed term.
7- Capital Formation Products: These are capital formation operations that include all operations whose purpose is to form capital linked to investment instruments, paid on a specific date in exchange for a premium or periodic premiums, without being linked to life or death probabilities.
8- Collective Investment Schemes: These are entities that operate in the field of employing investors' funds for the purpose of investing them on their behalf in various cases, in accordance with the principles of professional collective investment management, and are managed by a collective investment scheme manager in exchange for specified fees.

Article Two
Companies licensed to engage in life insurance and capital formation activities and their branches must obtain the necessary licenses from the Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig> before offering any life insurance or capital formation product if it falls under collective investment schemes. The Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig> shall study the applications submitted to it for life insurance and capital formation products to determine which of them fall under collective investment schemes. The Unit <orig>الوحدة</orig> shall study the insurance aspects related to the product. Companies must regularize the status of existing products that fall under life insurance and capital formation and provide the Unit <orig>الوحدة</orig> with a copy of the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> decision within 10 working days from its issuance date.

Article Three
None of the companies subject to the Unit <orig>الوحدة</orig> that hold a license to engage in life insurance and capital formation activities and their branches may market a collective investment scheme established in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> or abroad, except after obtaining a marketing license from the Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig>. Companies shall submit an application to the Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig> to obtain the necessary licenses and regularize their status, and provide the Unit <orig>الوحدة</orig> with a copy of the Capital Markets Authority <orig>هيئة أسواق المال</orig> decision within 10 working days from its issuance date.

Article Four

## Article Nine
The cancellation or suspension of the registration/enrollment of a registered/enrolled person shall not preclude the Unit's <orig>الوحدة</orig> right to take any action against this person in relation to any violation committed during their registration/enrollment period.

## Article Ten
The licensed company <orig>الشركة المرخص لها</orig> shall be responsible for submitting an application for the registration/nomination of any individual working for it in positions requiring registration with the Unit <orig>الوحدة</orig> and following up on the related procedures, in accordance with the form prepared for this purpose and issued by a decision of the Head of the Unit <orig>رئيس الوحدة</orig>.

## Article Eleven
An Interview Committee <orig>لجنة مقابلات</orig> shall be established within the Unit <orig>الوحدة</orig>, specialized in taking all necessary measures to verify the availability of technical and professional capabilities in accordance with the criteria specified in its establishment decision, which qualify the candidate for the position requiring registration. A decision shall be issued by the Head of the Unit <orig>رئيس الوحدة</orig> naming its members, its working mechanism, the controls related to registration/enrollment, and the necessary procedures in this regard. The Interview Committee <orig>لجنة المقابلات</orig> may conduct personal interviews for candidates and/or qualifying tests if required. The said committee shall submit its recommendations regarding the applications submitted to it to the Head of the Unit <orig>رئيس الوحدة</orig> to issue a decision of approval or rejection, provided that the rejection is reasoned.
In all cases, licensed companies <orig>الشركات المرخص لها</orig> may not appoint individuals to any of the positions requiring registration except after obtaining prior approval issued by the Head of the Unit <orig>رئيس الوحدة</orig>. Appointment without this approval shall be considered a violation of the Unit's <orig>الوحدة</orig> provisions and instructions.

## Article Twelve
The licensed company <orig>الشركة المرخص لها</orig> shall submit an application for the registration/nomination of one of the persons who meet the rules of efficiency and integrity contained in Annex No. (1) of this decision for registration in the positions requiring registration with it, to the Interview Committee <orig>لجنة المقابلات</orig> in the Unit <orig>الوحدة</orig> at least 90 days before the expected date of assuming the position.

## Article Thirteen
The Interview Committee <orig>لجنة المقابلات</orig> may request from the licensed company <orig>الشركة المرخص لها</orig> at any time after receiving the nomination/registration application any additional information or documents. In case of failure to provide the information and documents within the period specified by the committee without an acceptable excuse, the application shall be considered null and void.
The Interview Committee <orig>لجنة المقابلات</orig> shall decide on the applications presented to it that meet all requirements and documents within 90 days from the date of completion. Upon a request submitted by the committee to the Head of the Unit <orig>رئيس الوحدة</orig>, the decision period may be extended for a similar period or periods, provided that it does not exceed 6 months from the date of completion.

## Article Fourteen
Priority for nomination/registration for positions requiring registration shall be given to Kuwaiti citizens <orig>المواطن الكويتي</orig>. In all cases, the registered/enrolled person must be

Positions Requiring Registration: The register prepared by the Unit <orig>الوحدة</orig> for the registration/enrollment of occupants of positions requiring registration.
Nomination/Registration Application: The form and documents submitted to the Interview Committee <orig>لجنة المقابلات</orig> by the licensed company <orig>الشركة المرخص لها</orig> for the registration/enrollment of an individual to occupy positions requiring registration, in accordance with the procedures and requirements contained in this decision.
Registered/Enrolled Person: The nominated person who meets the conditions contained in this decision and whose appointment has been approved by a decision of the Head of the Unit <orig>رئيس الوحدة</orig> with the licensed company <orig>الشركة المرخص لها</orig>.

## Article Two
Those subject to these rules <orig>الخاضعون</orig> shall adhere to the rules of efficiency and integrity in the conditions required for positions requiring registration with the Unit <orig>الوحدة</orig>, in accordance with Annex No. (1) of this decision.

## Article Three
Subject to Decision No. (58) of 2023 regarding the issuance of corporate governance rules, those subject to these rules <orig>الخاضعون</orig> shall adhere to the conditions required for positions requiring registration with the Unit <orig>الوحدة</orig>, in accordance with Annex No. (2) of this decision.

## Article Four
Annex No. (3) of this decision specifies the accredited professional certificates for continuing education purposes. The said annex shall be updated periodically in accordance with what the Supreme Committee <orig>اللجنة العليا</orig> deems appropriate and determines.

## Article Five
Those subject to these rules <orig>الخاضعون</orig> shall adhere to the prescribed percentage by the competent authority <orig>الجهة المختصة</orig> according to the aforementioned law, and the mechanism and controls for employing Kuwaiti labor <orig>العمالة الكويتية</orig> in licensed companies <orig>الشركات المرخص لها</orig> as stipulated in Annex No. (4) of this decision. The said annex shall be updated periodically in accordance with what the Supreme Committee <orig>اللجنة العليا</orig> deems appropriate and determines.

## Article Six
Those subject to the Unit's <orig>الوحدة</orig> supervision shall commit to qualifying and training national cadres <orig>الكوادر الوطنية</orig> working in the company to obtain the professional certificates listed in Annex No. (3) of this decision. Companies shall provide the Unit <orig>الوحدة</orig> with annual reports in this regard, in accordance with the regulating decisions and circulars issued by the Head of the Unit <orig>رئيس الوحدة</orig> in this regard.

## Article Seven
The Unit <orig>الوحدة</orig> shall maintain a special register for the registration/enrollment of positions requiring registration with it. Registration/enrollment in this register shall take place after fulfilling the conditions and requirements contained in this decision.

## Article Eight
The Head of the Unit <orig>رئيس الوحدة</orig> may cancel the registration/enrollment of any person registered/enrolled with it if they fail to meet or violate the conditions and terms related to their work.
The Head of the Unit <orig>رئيس الوحدة</orig> may also suspend the registration/enrollment of any person registered/enrolled with it and take all measures deemed appropriate to ensure that the person meets the conditions and terms related to their work, and may reinstate their registration/enrollment.
