### Article Fifteen
With due regard to administrative circumstances that require assigning a person to perform the duties of individuals holding registrable positions for a specified period, the following must be adhered to:
1. Notifying the Unit <orig>الوحدة</orig> of the details of the person assigned to perform the duties of the holder of the registrable position, specifying the period and the powers granted to them.
2. The assignment period shall not exceed 6 months, and may be extended after obtaining prior approval from the Unit <orig>الوحدة</orig>.

### Article Sixteen
With due regard to the provisions of Article No. (15) of this Resolution, no one other than those registered in the Unit's <orig>الوحدة</orig> records may hold registrable positions in any way whatsoever.

### Article Seventeen
A person registered in the Unit's <orig>الوحدة</orig> registrable positions record may not, in any way whatsoever, hold any registrable position for more than one licensed company.

### Article Eighteen
In cases where a registrable position is vacant, licensed companies must adhere to the following:
1. Notifying the Unit <orig>الوحدة</orig> upon the termination of an individual's occupancy of a registrable position within five working days from the date of the vacancy of this position, in accordance with the form prepared for this purpose.
2. Filling the registrable position within six months from the date of notifying the Unit <orig>الوحدة</orig>.

### Article Nineteen
A fee of two hundred Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> (200 K.D.) shall be collected for each application submitted by licensed companies for nomination for registration in a registrable position. Payment shall be made upon submission of the application, and no application that has not paid the fee will be considered.

### Article Twenty
Violation of this Resolution shall result in the legal liability stipulated in the Law and its Executive Regulations, without prejudice to other relevant laws.

### Article Twenty-One
The Head of the Unit <orig>رئيس الوحدة</orig> shall issue all necessary executive resolutions for the establishment of the Interview Committee <orig>لجنة المقابلات</orig> responsible for considering applications for nomination for registration in registrable positions, as well as resolutions related to the controls and procedures for the committee's work and the mechanism for submitting registration applications within 3 months from the date this Resolution comes into effect. Companies shall be granted a grace period to submit their applications and regularize their status until 2026/03/31.

### Article Twenty-Two
This Resolution shall come into effect from the date of its issuance and shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>. The competent authorities shall implement it, each within its jurisdiction.

Chairman of the Supreme Committee <orig>اللجنة العليا</orig>
**Mohammed Sulaiman Al-Otaibi <orig>محمد سليمان العتيبي</orig>**

Issued on May 22, 2025 AD
Annex No. (1) Resolution No. (12) of 2025
Regarding the Conditions Required for Registrable Positions
Competence and Integrity Rules for Registrable Positions within the Unit <orig>الوحدة</orig>
The application of competence and integrity rules applies to licensed persons and to registrable positions held by licensed persons.
The person registered in registrable positions with licensed persons must adhere to the competence and integrity rules throughout their registration period.
If any of the conditions of the competence and integrity rules cease to exist, the Unit <orig>الوحدة</orig> may cancel or suspend the registration of the registered person, and may re-register them if they fulfill those conditions.
The nominated person must possess the following:
1. Appropriate professional experience in a field consistent with the nature of the work of the licensed entity and the position for which they are nominated.
2. Passing interviews and qualifying tests as determined by the Unit <orig>الوحدة</orig> according to the issued standards.
3. Technical, leadership, and administrative capabilities that allow for independence in work, making correct decisions, and understanding all technical requirements and developments related to workflow.
4. Commitment to fulfilling all assigned tasks and responsibilities, and working towards achieving the objectives of the licensed entity.
5. Continuous awareness of all professional and administrative developments.
6. Fulfilling the requirements stated in Annex No. (2) of this Resolution.
7. Not having a final judgment issued against them in a crime affecting honor or trust, or related to money laundering and terrorist financing, or capital market crimes, or corruption crimes, unless they have been rehabilitated.
8. Being of good reputation and conduct.
9. Not having been previously dismissed from their position or job by a disciplinary decision issued by a supervisory authority or by a final judicial ruling.
10. Not having been declared bankrupt unless they have been rehabilitated or a decision was issued to imprison them for a debt owed.
11. Any other conditions issued by a decision of the Head of the Unit <orig>رئيس الوحدة</orig>.
In all cases, the Unit <orig>الوحدة</orig> may take all measures it deems appropriate.

| **Senior Executives and Those of Similar Status Appointed in Insurance Activities** | - Holds a university degree or its equivalent and has experience in the insurance / financial / legal / administrative field or related work for a period of no less than 10 years. <br> - Holds one of the professional certificates approved in the insurance field listed in Annex No. (3) or similar certificates approved by the Unit, and preference is given to those with more than 15 years of experience in the insurance field, exempting them from the professional certificate requirement. |
| **Risk Management Director and Those of Similar Status** | - Holds a university degree or its equivalent and has experience in the insurance / financial / legal / administrative field or related work for a period of no less than 8 years. <br> - Holds one of the professional certificates approved in the field of risk management listed in Annex No. (3) or similar certificates approved by the Unit. |
| **Compliance Officer and Those of Similar Status** | - Holds a university degree or its equivalent and has experience in the insurance / financial / legal / administrative field or related work for a period of no less than 5 years. <br> - Holds one of the professional certificates approved in the field of anti-money laundering and combating terrorist financing and/or regulatory compliance listed in Annex No. (3) or similar certificates approved by the Unit. |
| **Internal Sharia Auditor and Those of Similar Status** | - Holds a university degree or its equivalent and has experience in the field of Sharia auditing for a period of no less than 3 years. <br> - Holds one of the professional certificates approved in the field of Sharia auditing listed in Annex No. (3) or similar certificates approved by the Unit. |
| **Financial Manager and Those of Similar Status** | - Holds a university degree or its equivalent and has experience in the field of financial control / financial management / internal auditing / accounting work, or related work for a period of no less than 10 years. <br> - Holds one of the professional certificates approved in the financial field listed in Annex No. (3) or similar certificates approved by the Unit, and preference is given to those with more than 15 years of experience in the financial field, exempting them from the professional certificate requirement. |
| **Internal Audit Officer and Those of Similar Status** | - Holds a university degree or its equivalent and has experience in the field of internal auditing or related work for a period of no less than 10 years. <br> - Holds one of the professional certificates approved in the internal auditing field listed in Annex No. (2) or similar certificates approved by the Unit, and preference is given to those with more than 15 years of experience in the financial management field, exempting them from the professional certificate requirement. |
| **Legal Affairs Director and Those of Similar Status** | - Holds a university degree or its equivalent and has experience in legal affairs for a period of no less than 10 years. |
| **Insurance Broker Manager and/or Reinsurance Broker Manager** | - Holds a post-secondary diploma or its equivalent and has experience in the insurance field for a period of no less than 10 years. <br> - Holds one of the professional certificates approved in the insurance field listed in Annex No. (3) or similar certificates approved by the Unit. <br> - Holds a secondary school qualification or its equivalent and has experience in the insurance field for a period of no less than 12 years. <br> - Holds one of the professional certificates approved in the insurance field listed in Annex No. (3) or similar certificates approved by the Unit, and preference is given to those with more than 15 years of experience in the insurance field, exempting them from the professional certificate requirement. |
| **Insurance Agent Manager** | - Holds a university degree or its equivalent and has experience in the insurance field for a period of no less than 7 years. |

*   **Executive Regulations:** The Executive Regulations <orig>اللائحة التنفيذية</orig> of Law No. (125) of 2019 <orig>القانون رقم (125) لسنة 2019</orig> concerning the Regulation of Insurance <orig>تنظيم التأمين</orig> and its amendments.
*   **Unit:** The Insurance Regulatory Unit <orig>وحدة تنظيم التأمين</orig>.
*   **Interviews Committee:** The committee established by a decision of the Head of the Unit <orig>رئيس الوحدة</orig>, responsible for taking all necessary measures to verify the availability of technical and professional capabilities of candidates in accordance with the criteria specified in its establishment decision, which qualify the candidate for the position requiring registration.
*   **Positions Requiring Registration:** The position of an independent board member <orig>عضو مجلس الإدارة المستقل</orig> whose occupant is required to be registered with the Unit <orig>الوحدة</orig> in accordance with the conditions and procedures stipulated in this decision and before commencing their duties.
*   **Competence and Integrity Rules:** The set of standards and procedures stipulated in this decision to ensure the eligibility of the candidate for the position requiring registration <orig>المنصب واجب التسجيل</orig> in terms of experience, qualifications, integrity, and financial probity.
*   **Licensed Company:** A company licensed by the Unit <orig>الوحدة</orig> and committed to the provisions of the Law <orig>القانون</orig>, the Executive Regulations <orig>اللائحة التنفيذية</orig>, and the decisions and circulars issued by the Unit <orig>الوحدة</orig>.
*   **Register of Positions Requiring Registration:** The register prepared by the Unit <orig>الوحدة</orig> for the registration of occupants of positions requiring registration <orig>المناصب واجبة التسجيل</orig>.
*   **Nomination/Registration Application:** The form and documents submitted to the Interviews Committee <orig>لجنة المقابلات</orig> by the Licensed Company <orig>الشركة المرخص لها</orig> for the registration of a person to occupy a position requiring registration <orig>المناصب واجب التسجيل</orig> in accordance with the procedures and requirements stipulated in this decision.
*   **Registered Person:** The nominated person who meets the conditions stipulated in this decision and whose appointment has been approved by a decision of the Head of the Unit <orig>رئيس الوحدة</orig> at the Licensed Company <orig>الشركة المرخص لها</orig>.

## Appendix No. (4) of Decision No. (12) of 2025
### Regarding the Conditions Required for Positions Requiring Registration
### Mechanism and Controls for Employing Kuwaiti Workforce for Subject Entities

Entities subject to the provisions of Law No. (125) of 2019 <orig>القانون رقم (125) لسنة 2019</orig> and its Executive Regulations <orig>لائحته التنفيذية</orig> and amendments, regarding the specified quota for national cadres working in the insurance sector, based on decisions issued by the Unit <orig>الوحدة</orig> and/or competent authorities <orig>الجهات المختصة</orig> in terms of percentage and academic qualifications, must adhere to the following conditions:
1.  Companies must adhere to the percentage specified by the competent authority <orig>الجهة المختصة</orig> to meet the quota of Kuwaiti national labor <orig>العمالة الوطنية الكويتية</orig> out of the total workforce, and any amendments to this percentage.
2.  Distribute the percentage of Kuwaiti national labor <orig>العمالة الوطنية الكويتية</orig> across various departments of the company and not limit it to a single department for the purpose of meeting the quota.
3.  Apply the percentage of Kuwaiti national labor <orig>العمالة الوطنية الكويتية</orig> to the job grades of the licensee and to the job titles of the nominee, and not limit it to a single job grade or job title for the purpose of meeting the quota.
4.  Employ individuals with various academic qualifications, especially those holding a university degree, and not restrict the recruitment process to those with diploma qualifications and secondary school certificates.
5.  Provide necessary training and qualification programs for all company employees annually, in accordance with the professional certificates listed in Appendix No. (3).
6.  Provide remote (online) training programs via video conferencing if training programs are delivered by international personnel.
7.  Establish an internal policy regarding the process of attracting Kuwaiti national labor <orig>العمالة الوطنية الكويتية</orig> and employees, and the company's needs percentage across its various departments at the end of each fiscal year.
8.  The internal policy must include:
    a. The number of employees the company wishes to hire to complete the Kuwaiti labor quota.
    b. Advertising company vacancies and the method of publishing the advertisement through the company's website and social media.
    c. Defining job requirements for fresh graduates and experienced individuals.
9.  Any other data or conditions specified by the Unit <orig>الوحدة</orig>.

## Article Two
Those subject to this decision shall adhere to the rules of efficiency and integrity regarding the conditions required for positions subject to registration with the Unit, in accordance with Annex No. (1) of this Decision.

## Article Three
Without prejudice to Decision No. (58) of 2023 regarding the issuance of corporate governance rules, those subject to this decision shall adhere to the conditions required for positions subject to registration with the Unit, in accordance with Annex No. (2) of this Decision.

## Article Four
The Unit shall maintain a special register for the registration of positions subject to registration with it. Registration in this register shall take place after fulfilling the conditions and requirements stipulated in this Decision.

## Article Five
The Head of the Unit <orig>رئيس الوحدة</orig> may cancel the registration of any person registered with it if they fail to meet or violate the terms and conditions related to their work.
The Head of the Unit <orig>رئيس الوحدة</orig> may also suspend the registration of any person registered with it and take all measures deemed appropriate to ensure that the person meets the terms and conditions related to their work. They may reinstate their registration if it is found that they have not violated those terms and conditions.

## Article Six
The cancellation or suspension of a registered person's registration shall not preclude the Unit's right to take any action against that person regarding any violation committed during their registration period.

## Article Seven
The licensed company <orig>الشركة المرخص لها</orig> shall be responsible for submitting an application for the registration/nomination of any individual working for it in positions subject to registration with the Unit and for following up on the related procedures, in accordance with the form prepared for this purpose and issued by a decision of the Head of the Unit <orig>رئيس الوحدة</orig>.

## Article Eight
An Interview Committee <orig>لجنة مقابلات</orig> shall be established within the Unit, tasked with taking all necessary measures to verify the availability of technical and professional capabilities in accordance with the standards specified in its establishment decision, which qualify the candidate for the position subject to registration. A decision shall be issued by the Head of the Unit <orig>رئيس الوحدة</orig> naming its members, its working mechanism, the controls for registration, and the necessary rules in this regard. The Interview Committee <orig>لجنة المقابلات</orig> may conduct personal interviews for candidates and/or qualifying tests if required. The said committee shall submit its recommendations regarding the applications submitted to it to the Head of the Unit <orig>رئيس الوحدة</orig> to issue a decision of approval or rejection, provided that the rejection is reasoned.
In all cases, licensed companies <orig>الشركات المرخص لها</orig> may not appoint individuals to positions subject to registration except after obtaining prior approval from the Head of the Unit <orig>رئيس الوحدة</orig>. Appointment without this approval shall be considered a violation of the Unit's provisions and instructions.

## Article Nine
The Interview Committee <orig>لجنة المقابلات</orig> may, at any time after receiving an application for nomination/registration for positions subject to registration, request the licensed company <orig>الشركة المرخص لها</orig> to provide any additional information or documents. If the information and documents are not submitted within the period specified by the committee without an acceptable excuse, the application shall be considered null and void.
The Interview Committee <orig>لجنة المقابلات</orig> shall decide on the applications presented to it that meet all requirements and documents within 90 days from the date of fulfillment. Upon a request submitted by the committee, the Head of the Unit <orig>رئيس الوحدة</orig> may extend the decision period for a similar period or periods, provided that it does not exceed 6 months from the date of fulfillment.

## Article Ten
Priority for nomination/registration for a position subject to registration shall be given to Kuwaiti citizens. In all cases, a person registered in a position subject to registration – if not a Kuwaiti citizen – must be a resident of the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> in accordance with the relevant laws and decisions issued in this regard.

## Article Eleven
Without prejudice to the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig>, the same person may not be appointed to positions subject to registration for more than one licensed company <orig>شركة مرخص لها</orig> except after obtaining prior approval from the Unit for each position separately, in accordance with the procedures and conditions stipulated in this Decision and any other decisions issued in this regard.
In all cases, individuals not registered in the Unit's records may not occupy positions subject to registration in any way whatsoever.

## Article Twelve
In cases where one of the positions subject to registration is vacant, licensed companies <orig>الشركات المرخص لها</orig> shall adhere to the following:
1- Notify the Unit upon the termination of an individual's occupancy of a position subject to registration within five working days from the date of occupying this position, in accordance with the form prepared for this purpose and issued by a decision of the Head of the Unit <orig>رئيس الوحدة</orig>.
2- Fill the position subject to registration within six months from the date of notifying the Unit.

## Article Thirteen
A fee of two hundred Kuwaiti Dinars (K.D. 200) shall be collected for each application submitted by licensed companies <orig>الشركات المرخص لها</orig> for nomination/registration in a position subject to registration. Payment shall be made upon submission of the application, and no application that fails to pay the fee shall be considered.

## Article Fourteen
Violation of this Decision shall entail legal liability as stipulated in the Law and its Executive Regulations, without prejudice to other relevant laws.

Annex No. (1) of Resolution No. (13) of 2025
regarding the conditions that must be met for mandatory registration positions (Independent
Board Member)
Rules of Competence and Integrity for Mandatory Registration Positions with the Unit
The rules of competence and integrity apply to licensed persons
and to mandatory registration positions with licensed persons.
The person registered in mandatory registration positions with
licensed persons must adhere to the rules of competence and integrity throughout their
registration period.
If one of the conditions of the rules of competence and integrity ceases to exist, the Unit may cancel
or suspend the registration of the registered person, and may re-register them if they fulfill those conditions.
The nominated person must possess the following:
1. Appropriate professional experience in a field consistent with the nature of the
licensed entity's work and the position for which they are nominated.
2. Passing interviews and qualifying tests as determined by the Unit according to
the issued standards.
3. Technical, leadership, and administrative capabilities that enable them to work
independently, make correct decisions, and comprehend all technical
requirements and developments related to workflow.
4. Commitment to fulfilling all assigned tasks and responsibilities, and working
towards achieving the objectives of the licensed entity.

# Central Bank of Kuwait <orig>بنك الكويت المركزي</orig>
## Resolution No. 1 / 68 – R / 2025

Governor of the Central Bank of Kuwait <orig>محافظ بنك الكويت المركزي</orig>
Having reviewed Articles (21) and (61) of Law No. (32) of 1968 concerning Currency, the Central Bank of Kuwait <orig>بنك الكويت المركزي</orig>, the Regulation of the Banking Profession, and its amendments.
And Articles (4), (5), and (7) of Ministerial Resolution No. (40) of 2003 regarding the Regulations of the Islamic Banks Register at the Central Bank of Kuwait <orig>بنك الكويت المركزي</orig>.
And based on the request of Boubyan Bank <orig>بنك بوبيان</orig> dated 23 and 30/4/2025 regarding the amendment of its data in the Islamic Banks Register at the Central Bank of Kuwait <orig>بنك الكويت المركزي</orig>.
Has resolved

### Article One
The following amendments to Boubyan Bank's <orig>بنك بوبيان</orig> data shall be recorded in the Islamic Banks Register at the Central Bank of Kuwait <orig>بنك الكويت المركزي</orig>:

1.  Increase in the Bank's authorized and paid-up capital from KWD 420,078,363.800 to KWD 441,082,281.900, with the increase representing 5% bonus shares.
2.  Increase in the legal reserve from KWD 372,175,150 to KWD 382,349,467 (including a share premium of KWD 316,942,493).
    This is in accordance with the Bank's final financial statements for the fiscal year ended 31/12/2024.
3.  Reappointment of the Sharia Supervisory Board <orig>هيئة الرقابة الشرعية</orig> members for the fiscal year ending 31/12/2025 as follows:
    *   Dr. Abdulaziz Khalifa Al-Qassar <orig>عبدالعزيز خليفة القصار</orig>
    *   Dr. Issam Khalaf Al-Enezi <orig>عصام خلف العنزي</orig>
    *   Dr. Mohammed Awad Al-Fuzai <orig>محمد عود الفزيع</orig>
    *   Dr. Ali Ibrahim Al-Rashed <orig>علي إبراهيم الراشد</orig>
4.  Reappointment of Mr. Bader Abdullah Al-Wazzan <orig>بدر عبدالله الوزان</orig> from Al-Wazzan & Partners (Deloitte & Touche), and Mr. Abdulkarim Abdullah Al-Samdan <orig>عبدالكريم عبدالله السمدان</orig> from Al-Aiban & Al-Osaimi & Partners (Ernst & Young) as auditors for the Bank's accounts for the fiscal year ending 31/12/2025.
5.  Election of the Bank's Board of Directors <orig>مجلس إدارة البنك</orig> members for the term (2025-2027) from the following gentlemen:
    *   Abdulaziz Abdullah Dakheel Al-Shaya <orig>عبدالعزيز عبدالله دخيل الشايع</orig> Chairman of the Board of Directors <orig>رئيس مجلس الإدارة</orig>
    *   Adel Abdulwahab Jassim Al-Majed <orig>عادل عبدالوهاب جاسم الماجد</orig> Deputy Chairman of the Board of Directors <orig>نائب رئيس مجلس الإدارة</orig>
    *   Waleed Khalid Ahmed Al-Yaqout <orig>وليد خالد أحمد الياقوت</orig> Independent Board Member <orig>عضو مجلس إدارة مستقل</orig>
    *   Fahad Ahmed Abdullatif Al-Fouzan <orig>فهد أحمد عبداللطيف الفوزان</orig> Non-Independent Board Member <orig>عضو مجلس إدارة غير مستقل</orig>
    *   Mohammed Yousef Ahmed Al-Saqer <orig>محمد يوسف أحمد الصقر</orig> Non-Independent Board Member <orig>عضو مجلس إدارة غير مستقل</orig>
    *   Waleed Mishari Yousef Al-Hamad <orig>وليد مشاري يوسف الحمد</orig> Non-Independent Board Member <orig>عضو مجلس إدارة غير مستقل</orig>
    *   Hazem Ali Mishari Al-Mutairi <orig>حازم علي مشاري المطيري</orig> Independent Board Member <orig>عضو مجلس إدارة مستقل</orig>
    *   Khalid Ahmed Saud Al-Masaf <orig>خالد أحمد سعود المصف</orig> Independent Board Member <orig>عضو مجلس إدارة مستقل</orig>
    *   Abdullah Saud Bader Al-Bader <orig>عبدالله سعود بدر البدر</orig> Independent Board Member <orig>عضو مجلس إدارة مستقل</orig>
    *   Dr. Amani Khalid Mohammed Bourseli <orig>أماني خالد محمد بورسلي</orig> Independent Board Member <orig>عضو مجلس إدارة مستقل</orig>
    *   Rabah Abdulrahman Ahmed Al-Rabah <orig>رباح عبدالرحمن أحمد الرباح</orig> Independent Board Member <orig>عضو مجلس إدارة مستقل</orig>

### Article Two
This Resolution shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> and shall be effective from the date of its issuance.
The Governor

# Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>
## Minutes of Announcement of Sale of Seized Items

The Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig> - Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> - announces that on Wednesday, 2025/6/4, at 10:30 AM, the seized items of Mr. Kitchen Ready-Made Kitchens Company <orig>شركة مستر كيتشن المطابخ الجاهزة</orig> will be sold by public auction at the company's premises located in Shuwaikh Industrial Area <orig>الشويخ الصناعية</orig> - Plot 1 <orig>قطعة 1</orig> - Street 25 <orig>شارع 25</orig> - Parcel 53 <orig>قسيمة 53</orig>. These items are detailed in the executive seizure minutes dated 2025/4/28, which were seized in favor of / Mohammed Hameed Taqi Akbar <orig>محمد حميد تقي أكبر</orig> - in execution of Judgment No. 2023/2904 Commercial Plenary / 50, for the payment of an amount of (2,973,905 K.D. <orig>د.ك</orig>).
If this day is not sufficient to complete the sale, it will be completed on the following three days. Those wishing to purchase must attend at the time and place specified above. For more information, the Enforcement Section <orig>قسم التنفيذ</orig> can be consulted during official working hours (New Palace of Justice <orig>قصر العدل الجديد</orig> - Third Floor).

(DA/M/750) Provision of Central Kitchen Cleaning Services at the Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig>

The Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig> announces the launch of Practice No. (DA/M/750) for the provision of central kitchen cleaning services at the Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig>. Companies or establishments specialized in this field wishing to participate should apply to obtain the terms and conditions booklet and practice documents during official working hours from (Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig> – Bayan Palace <orig>قصر بيان</orig> – Administrative Building – First Floor – Zone 7 – Tenders and Follow-up Department <orig>إدارة المناقصات والمتابعة</orig>), starting from the date of publication of this announcement in the Official Gazette (Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>), for a non-refundable fee of (K.D. 150/-) only one hundred and fifty Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> (K-Net payment only) for the booklet, during official working hours from 8:30 AM to 1:30 PM, taking into account the following:
- 1. The deadline for submitting bids is 1:30 PM on Thursday, 29/5/2025. No bids will be accepted after this time.
- 2. Bids must be submitted in a sealed envelope to the Tenders and Follow-up Department <orig>إدارة المناقصات والمتاببة</orig> - Bayan Palace <orig>قصر بيان</orig> – Administrative Building – First Floor – Zone 7.
- 3. Submission of an initial security deposit of 2% of the bid value in favor of the Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig> in the form of a letter of guarantee or a certified check from one of the Kuwaiti banks <orig>البنوك الكويتية</orig>, valid throughout the bid validity period of (90) days.
- 4. Submission of a valid national labor percentage compliance certificate and a tax compliance certificate.
- 5. A letter of authorization and a copy of the civil ID for the company representative to purchase the practice document.
- 6. This practice is indivisible, and alternative offers are not permitted.
- 7. The practitioner must submit a letter accompanied by a copy of the registration certificate with the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة تجارة وصناعة الكويت</orig>.

The bid must remain valid for a period of (90) days from the closing date, with the Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig> reserving its right to extend or renew this period for such duration(s) as it deems appropriate to complete the award procedures.

For inquiries, please call the following numbers:
- Direct: 22011427-22011437
- Email: Ma.almatouq@da.gov.kw

Undersecretary for Financial, Administrative and Staff Affairs

# Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig>
## Correction
A material error occurred during the publication of the administrative decisions of the Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig> (Nos. 22, 29, 28, 25, and 24) published in the Official Gazette, Issue 1739, dated 18/5/2025 AD. The error was in the date of issuance of the decisions, which was stated as 14/5/2025 AD, and the correct date is: 7/5/2025 AD.
Therefore, we are re-publishing after correcting the error.

## Decision No. PAI (22) of 2025
### Regarding the Imposition of an Administrative Penalty
Acting Director General
Having reviewed:
- Law No. (56) of 1996 regarding the issuance of the Industry Law <orig>قانون الصناعة</orig> and its executive regulations and their amendments.
- Ministerial Decision No. (2025/5) issued on 9/3/2025, authorizing the Director General of the Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig> to impose warning and closure penalties on violating industrial projects.
- The violation report submitted by the Environmental Control Department <orig>قسم الرقابة البيئية</orig> No. (C - 45), dated 27/10/2024, which includes the commission of the following violation by / Al-Habs Aluminum Workshops Company <orig>شركة الهابس لورش الألومنيوم</orig>:
  - Establishing a project, engaging in an activity, or adding a product without obtaining the approval of the Environment Public Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للبيئة</orig>, in violation of Article (16) of Environmental Protection Law No. 42/2014 <orig>قانون حماية البيئة</orig> and its amendments.
- The recommendation of the Permanent Committee for Industrial Violations <orig>اللجنة الدائمة للمخالفات الصناعية</orig> in its meeting No. (494/2024/13) held on 18/12/2024.
- And based on what was presented by Mr./ Deputy Director General for Standards and Industrial Services <orig>نائب المدير العام للمواصفات والخدمات الصناعية</orig>.
And in furtherance of the public interest.

Has decided
(Article One)
To warn / Al-Habs Aluminum Workshops Company <orig>شركة الهابس لورش الألومنيوم</orig>.
Located in Al-Rai <orig>الري</orig> area - Plot (1) - Parcel (1752) - Shop No. (26) Ground Floor, of the necessity to remove the aforementioned violation within a maximum period of (three months). In the event of failure to remove the violation, stricter measures will be taken in accordance with the applicable rules in this regard.
(Article Two)
This decision shall be effective from the date of its publication in the Official Gazette, and the concerned authorities shall implement it, each within its jurisdiction.

Acting Director General of the Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig>
Issued on: 7 May 2025 AD

# Resolution No. H.A.S. <orig>هـ ع ص</orig> (26) of 2025
## Regarding the Closure of a Plot/Premise

The Acting Director General
After reviewing:
*   Law No. (56) of 1996 regarding the issuance of the Industry Law and its Executive Regulations and their amendments.
*   Ministerial Resolution No. (5/2025) issued on 9/3/2025, delegating the Director General of the Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig> to impose warning and closure penalties on violating industrial projects.
*   Violation report submitted by the Environmental Control Department <orig>قسم الرقابة البيئية</orig> No. (C-42), dated 17/10/2024, detailing the following violations committed by Al-Watan <orig>الوطن</orig> Paper Tissues Production Factory:
    - Establishing a project, engaging in an activity, or adding a product without obtaining the approval of the Environment Public Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للبيئة</orig>, in violation of Article (16) of Environmental Protection Law No. 42/2014 and its amendments.
    - Failure to use modern, advanced, and environmentally friendly technologies in production processes and ventilation systems.
    - Insufficient ventilation in production and storage areas.
    - Random storage.
*   Recommendation of the Permanent Committee for Industrial Violations <orig>اللجنة الدائمة للمخالفات الصناعية</orig> in its meeting No. (494/13/2024) held on 18/12/2024.
*   And based on what was presented by Mr. / Deputy Director General for Industrial Standards and Services <orig>نائب المدير العام للمواصفات والخدمات الصناعية</orig>.
And in furtherance of the public interest.

Has decided:
(Article One)
Closure of / Farah Aluminum Workshops Company <orig>شركة فرح لورش الألمنيوم</orig>.
Plot No. (1868) - (Full Basement) - located in Al-Rai <orig>الري</orig> area - Block (1) - belonging to M/s. / Al-Watan <orig>الوطن</orig> Paper Tissues Production Company - until the violations and their consequences are removed.
(Article Two)
In case the violation is not removed after (one month) from the date of closure, a more severe penalty shall be imposed.
(Article Three)
This Resolution shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> and shall be effective from its date of issuance, and the concerned authorities shall implement it, each within its jurisdiction.
Acting Director General of the Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig>

# Resolution No. H.A.S. <orig>هـ ع ص</orig> (25) of 2025
## Imposing an Administrative Penalty

The Acting Director General
After reviewing:
*   Law No. (56) of 1996 regarding the issuance of the Industry Law and its Executive Regulations and their amendments.
*   Ministerial Resolution No. (5/2025) issued on 9/3/2025, delegating the Director General of the Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig> to impose warning and closure penalties on violating industrial projects.
*   Violation report submitted by the Environmental Control Department <orig>قسم الرقابة البيئية</orig> No. (C-47), dated 27/10/2024, detailing the following violations committed by Farah Aluminum Workshops Company <orig>شركة فرح لورش الألمنيوم</orig>:
    - Establishing a project, engaging in an activity, or adding a product without obtaining the approval of the Environment Public Authority <orig>الهيئة العامة للبيئة</orig>, in violation of Article (16) of Environmental Protection Law No. 42/2014 and its amendments.
*   Recommendation of the Permanent Committee for Industrial Violations <orig>اللجنة الدائمة للمخالفات الصناعية</orig> in its meeting No. (494/13/2024) held on 18/12/2024.
*   And based on what was presented by Mr. / Deputy Director General for Industrial Standards and Services <orig>نائب المدير العام للمواصفات والخدمات الصناعية</orig>.
And in furtherance of the public interest.

Has decided:
(Article One)
Warning to / Farah Aluminum Workshops Company <orig>شركة فرح لورش الألمنيوم</orig>.
Plot (1752) - Solution No. (1) - Block (1) - located in Al-Rai <orig>الري</orig> area (18), Ground Floor, regarding the necessity of removing the aforementioned violation within a maximum period of (three months). In case of failure to remove the violation, more severe measures will be taken in accordance with the applicable rules in this regard.
(Article Two)
This Resolution shall be effective from the date of its publication in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>, and the concerned authorities shall implement it, each within its jurisdiction.
Acting Director General of the Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig>

<header>Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig> Issue 1740 Seventy-First Year 6 Sunday 27 Dhu al-Qi'dah 1446 AH - 2025/5/25 AD</header>

- Ministerial Decision No. (2025/5) issued on 2025/3/9, authorizing the Director General of the Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig> to impose warning and closure penalties on violating industrial projects.
- Violation report submitted by the Environmental Control Department <orig>قسم الرقابة البيئية</orig> No. (40-C) issued on 2024/9/25, stating that Al-Makhiyat Al-Sab'a for Navigation Company / Al-Makhiyat Al-Sab'a Lil-Milaha <orig>المخيطات السبعة للملاحة</orig> (Khalid Saud Al-Rashed and Partners LLC <orig>خالد سعود الراشد وشركاه ذ.م.م</orig>) committed the following violations:
  - Failure to install, use, or maintain local control measures equipped with filters to limit the dispersion of dust, wood shavings, or gaseous pollutants.
  - Failure to use automatic suction devices to clean factory floors to prevent dust dispersion in the factory atmosphere.
  - Insufficient ventilation in production and storage areas.
- Recommendation of the Permanent Committee for Industrial Violations <orig>اللجنة الدائمة للمخالفات الصناعية</orig> in its meeting No. (494/2024/13) held on 2024/12/18.
- And based on what was presented by Mr. / Deputy Director General for Industrial Standards and Services <orig>نائب المدير العام للمواصفات والخدمات الصناعية</orig>.
- And in furtherance of the public interest.

Decided
### Article One
Closure of / Plot No. (169) located in Amghara Industrial Area <orig>منطقة امغرة الصناعية</orig> – Block (3), belonging to Al-Makhiyat Al-Sab'a for Navigation Company / Al-Makhiyat Al-Sab'a Lil-Milaha <orig>المخيطات السبعة للملاحة</orig> (Khalid Saud Al-Rashed and Partners LLC <orig>خالد سعود الراشد وشركاه ذ.م.م</orig>) – until the violations and their consequences are rectified.

### Article Two
In the event of failure to rectify the violation after (one month) from the date of closure, a more severe penalty shall be imposed.

### Article Three
This decision shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> and shall come into force from the date of its issuance. The concerned authorities shall implement it, each within its jurisdiction.

Acting Director General of the Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig>

## Decision No. H.A.S. (27) of 2025
### Regarding the Closure of a Plot

The Acting Director General
Having reviewed:
- Law No. (56) of 1996 regarding the issuance of the Industrial Law <orig>قانون الصناعة</orig>, its executive regulations, and their amendments.
- Ministerial Decision No. (2025/5) issued on 2025/3/9, authorizing the Director General of the Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig> to impose warning and closure penalties on violating industrial projects.
- Violation report submitted by the Environmental Control Department <orig>قسم الرقابة البيئية</orig> No. (38-C) issued on 2024/9/17, stating that Green Rubber Factory for Recycling Used (Damaged) Tires / Green Rubber Li-I'adat Tadwir Al-Itarat Al-Musta'mala (Al-Talifa) <orig>جرين ربر لإعادة تدوير الإطارات المستعملة (التالفة)</orig> committed the following violations:
  - Failure to use automatic suction devices to clean factory floors to prevent dust dispersion in the factory atmosphere.
  - Insufficient ventilation in production and storage areas.
  - Poor storage of chemical materials that may cause their reaction or emission of pollutants.
  - Presence of water near production equipment.
  - Insufficient operation of ventilation devices in production areas.
  - Spread of spray in the production area during the rubber cutting process.
- Recommendation of the Permanent Committee for Industrial Violations <orig>اللجنة الدائمة للمخالفات الصناعية</orig> in its meeting No. (494/2024/13) held on 2024/12/18.
- And based on what was presented by Mr. / Deputy Director General for Industrial Standards and Services <orig>نائب المدير العام للمواصفات والخدمات الصناعية</orig>.
- And in furtherance of the public interest.

Decided
### Article One
Closure of / Plot No. (17) located in Amghara Industrial Area <orig>منطقة امغرة الصناعية</orig> – Block (2), belonging to Green Rubber Factory for Recycling Used (Damaged) Tires / Green Rubber Li-I'adat Tadwir Al-Itarat Al-Musta'mala (Al-Talifa) <orig>جرين ربر لإعادة تدوير الإطارات المستعملة (التالفة)</orig> – until the violations and their consequences are rectified.

### Article Two
In the event of failure to rectify the violation after (one month) from the date of closure, a more severe penalty shall be imposed.

### Article Three
This decision shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> and shall come into force from the date of its issuance. The concerned authorities shall implement it, each within its jurisdiction.

Acting Director General of the Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig>

# Resolution No. H.A.S. (29) of 2025
## Regarding the Closure of a Plot
Acting Director General
Having reviewed:
*   Law No. (56) of 1996 regarding the issuance of the Industry Law and its executive regulations and amendments thereto.
*   Ministerial Resolution No. (2025/5) issued on 9/3/2025, authorizing the Director General of the Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig> to impose warning and closure penalties on violating industrial projects.
*   The violation report submitted by the Environmental Control Department <orig>قسم الرقابة البيئية</orig> No. (39-C), dated 24/9/2024, which includes the commission of the following violation by / Imdad Al-Hudooda for refining and packaging used vegetable oils for use in soap manufacturing and the production of glycerin and diesel <orig>امداد الحدودة لتكرير الزيوت النباتية المستعملة وتعبئتها لاستخدامها في صناعة الصابون وإنتاج الجلسرين والديزل</orig>:
    *   Discharging oils or materials not permitted for discharge into sewage networks, rainwater networks, or unpaved areas.
*   The recommendation of the Permanent Committee for Industrial Violations <orig>اللجنة الدائمة للمخالفات الصناعية</orig> in its meeting No. (494/2024/13) held on 18/12/2024.
*   And based on what was presented by Mr. / Deputy Director General for Industrial Specifications and Services <orig>نائب المدير العام للمواصفات والخدمات الصناعية</orig>.
*   And in furtherance of the public interest.

Has decided
(Article One)
To close / Shop No. (1) located in Al-Rai area <orig>منطقة الري</orig> – Plot (1) Parcel No. (1754) belonging to Messrs. / Imdad Al-Hudooda for refining and packaging used vegetable oils for use in soap manufacturing and the production of glycerin and diesel <orig>امداد الحدودة لتكرير الزيوت النباتية المستعملة وتعبئتها لاستخدامها في صناعة الصابون وإنتاج الجلسرين والديزل</orig> – until the violations and their consequences are removed.

(Article Two)
In the event that the violation is not removed after (one month) from the date of closure, a more severe penalty shall be imposed.

(Article Three)
This resolution shall be published in the Official Gazette and shall be effective from the date of its issuance. The concerned authorities shall implement it, each within its jurisdiction.

Issued on: 7 May 2025 AD
Acting Director General of the Public Authority for Industry <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig>

## Kuwait Municipality / Baladiyat Al-Kuwait <orig>بلدية الكويت</orig>
### Announcement (2025/56)
Regarding the re-issuance of Auction No. 2025/2024/3 (A) for the operation of a restaurant in the Heavy Vehicle Complex in Al-Shuwaikh area <orig>منطقة الشويخ</orig>, Kuwait Municipality / Baladiyat Al-Kuwait <orig>بلدية الكويت</orig> announces the re-issuance of Auction No. 2025/2024/3 (A) for the operation of a restaurant in the Heavy Vehicle Complex in Al-Shuwaikh area <orig>منطقة الشويخ</orig> (the site previously operated by the Kuwait Municipality Employees Union <orig>نقابة العاملين ببلدية الكويت</orig>). Specialized companies capable of providing all necessary requirements to perform the requested service at the best possible level of goods and services for this purpose, in terms of external appearance, staff attire and cleanliness, arrangement, organization, cleanliness, and quality of food items provided, and wishing to participate in this auction, should refer to Kuwait Municipality / Baladiyat Al-Kuwait <orig>بلدية الكويت</orig> (Administrative Building - 7th Floor - Tenders and Auctions Control Department) during official working hours to obtain the auction documents for a fee of K.D. 200/- (Two Hundred Kuwaiti Dinars only). This amount is non-refundable under any circumstances. Owners of small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) approved by the National Fund for SME Care and Development <orig>الصندوق الوطني لرعاية وتنمية المشروعات الصغيرة والمتوسطة</orig> are exempt from these fees. Those wishing to inspect the service performance site must conduct a thorough inspection to negate any ignorance before the date of the preliminary meeting to enable bidders to raise their inquiries during the preliminary meeting to achieve the principle of transparency.

### Announcement
### Invitation to Practice No. (01-2025/2026)
The General Presidency of the National Guard <orig>الرئاسة العامة للحرس الوطني</orig> announces the invitation to Practice No. (01-2025/2026) for the maintenance, operation, and management of the water treatment plant at Al-Tahrir Camp <orig>معسكر التحرير</orig>, in accordance with the conditions stated in the practice documents.
Therefore, companies and institutions wishing to participate in this practice must register on the official website of the General Presidency of the National Guard <orig>الرئاسة العامة للحرس الوطني</orig> (www.kng.gov.kw) to purchase the practice documents for an amount of (75) K.D. (seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only), non-refundable. Payment is to be made through the National Guard <orig>الحرس الوطني</orig> website using the (K-NET) service.
A preliminary meeting will be held at 10:00 AM on Monday, 02/06/2025, at the General Presidency of the National Guard <orig>الرئاسة العامة للحرس الوطني</orig> – Colonel Faisal Al-Khuraid <orig>فيصل الخريد</orig> Building. Participants, whether present or absent, will be bound by all decisions, recommendations, or clarifications included in the meeting. Participating companies and institutions must also print the minutes of the preliminary meeting from the official website of the General Presidency of the National Guard <orig>الرئاسة العامة للحرس الوطني</orig> (www.kng.gov.kw), approve it, and attach it with the bid documents.

## Al-Argan International Real Estate Company <orig>شركة الأرجان العالمية العقارية</orig>
### Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting
The Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting of the shareholders of Al-Argan International Real Estate Company <orig>شركة الأرجان العالمية العقارية</orig> – a Kuwaiti Public Shareholding Company – for the fiscal year ending December 31, 2024, was held at 11:30 AM on Monday, May 12, 2025, at the company's main headquarters, "Al-Argan Business Complex <orig>مجمع الأرجان للأعمال</orig>", located in the Free Trade Zone – Block (F98) – in the main hall.
The meeting was chaired by Mr. Haitham Sulaiman Hamoud Al-Khaled <orig>هيثم سليمان حمود الخالد</orig> – Chairman of the Board of Directors. The following also attended the meeting: -
*   Eng. Khaled Khader Mashaan Al-Khudair <orig>خالد خضر مشعان الخضير</orig> – Vice Chairman of the Board of Directors and Chief Executive Officer
*   Mr. Mohammed Abdel Hamid <orig>محمد عبد الحميد</orig> – Group Chief Financial Officer
*   Mr. Mohammed Hussein Al-Hreitli <orig>محمد حسين الحريتلي</orig> – Financial Controller
*   Mr. Nayef Musaed Al-Yaseen <orig>نايف مساعد الياسين</orig> – Company Auditor from RSM Al-Bazie & Partners <orig>RSM البزيع وشركاهم</orig> by authorization
*   Mr. Mohammed Bouhadi <orig>محمد بوهادي</orig> – Kuwait Clearing Company <orig>الشركة الكويتية للمقاصة</orig>
Shareholders holding 204,795,844 shares, in person and by proxy, attended the meeting through electronic voting and direct attendance. They represented 77.281% of the total free shares of the company, which number 265,000,000 shares after excluding treasury shares. Shareholders who participated through direct attendance represented 61.575% of the total free shares of the company. The percentage of shareholders in electronic voting represented 15.706% of the total free shares of the company.

Anyone objecting to this should refer to the Commercial Licenses Department within fifteen days from the date of publication of this announcement. No objection will be accepted unless it is based on a judicial ruling or an enforceable administrative order.
Undersecretary of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>

### Article (4) of the Company's Articles of Association and Article (5) of the Memorandum of Association before Amendment
The purposes for which the Company was established are as follows: -
1 - Owning shares in Kuwaiti or foreign joint-stock companies, as well as owning shares or stakes in Kuwaiti or foreign limited liability companies, or participating in the establishment of both types of these companies, managing them, lending to them, and guaranteeing them to third parties.
2 - Lending to companies in which it owns shares and guaranteeing them to third parties. In this case, the holding company's <orig>الشركة القابضة</orig> participation in the capital of the borrowing company must not be less than 20%.
3 - Owning industrial property rights such as patents, industrial trademarks, industrial designs, or any other related rights, and leasing them to other companies for exploitation, whether inside or outside Kuwait <orig>الكويت</orig>.
4 - Owning movable and immovable properties necessary for carrying out its activities within the limits permitted by law.
5 - Utilizing the financial surpluses available to the Company by investing them in financial portfolios managed by specialized companies and entities.
The Company shall have the right to carry out the aforementioned activities in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> and abroad, either as a principal or as an agent.
The Company may have an interest in or participate in any way with entities that engage in similar activities or that may assist it in achieving its objectives in Kuwait <orig>الكويت</orig> or abroad. It may establish, participate in, acquire, or affiliate with such entities.
### Article (4) of the Articles of Association after Amendment
1. (642051) Owning shares for the account of the holding company <orig>الشركة القابضة</orig> only.
2. (642040) Financing or lending to companies in which it owns shares or stakes and guaranteeing them to third parties. In this case, the holding company's <orig>الشركة القابضة</orig> participation in the capital of the borrowing company must not be less than twenty percent.
3. (642050) Owning intellectual property rights such as patents, trademarks, industrial designs, franchise rights, and other intangible rights, and exploiting and leasing them to its subsidiary holding companies <orig>الشركات القابضة التابعة لها</orig> and others.
4. (642030) Owning real estate and movable properties necessary for carrying out its business within the limits permitted by law.
5. (642020) Investing its funds in shares, bonds, and other securities.
6. (642010) Managing its subsidiary companies <orig>الشركات التابعة لها</orig> or participating in the management of other companies in which it holds shares and providing them with the necessary support.
7. (642070) Business management office for holding activities.
### Article 6 of the Articles of Association before Amendment
The Company's shares are nominal, and non-Kuwaitis <orig>غير الكويتيين</orig> may own them in accordance with the provisions of the law and the ministerial decisions regulating thereof.
### Article 6 of the Articles of Association after Amendment
The Company's shares are nominal, and non-Kuwaitis <orig>غير الكويتيين</orig> may not own them in accordance with the provisions of the law and the ministerial decisions regulating thereof.
### Article (10) of the Company's Articles of Association before Amendment
Each share entitles its owner to an equal share without discrimination in the ownership of the Company's assets and in the distributed profits as specified hereinafter.
### Article 10 of the Articles of Association after Amendment
Each share entitles its owner to an equal share without discrimination in the ownership of the Company's assets and in the distributed profits..
### Article (12) of the Company's Articles of Association before Amendment
Capital may not be increased unless the share installments have been fully paid. New shares may not be issued for less than their nominal value. If issued at a higher value, the increase shall first be allocated to cover issuance expenses, then to the reserve, or for share amortization.
### Article (12) of the Articles of Association after Amendment
The authorized capital may not be increased unless the value of the original shares has been fully paid. The Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> may authorize the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> to determine the date of its implementation.
### Article (13) of the Articles of Association before Amendment
To retain competent employees to work for the Company and enhance their loyalty to it, the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> has the right to establish a system called the Employee Stock Option <orig>خيار شراء الأسهم للموظفين</orig> plan, in accordance with the conditions stipulated in Ministerial Resolution No. (337) of 2004.
1 - To meet the Company's obligations under the Employee Stock Option <orig>خيار شراء الأسهم للموظفين</orig> plan, the Company's capital may be increased, provided that the total increases to the paid-up capital do not exceed 10% over a maximum period of ten years from the start of the program's implementation.
2 - The annual report of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> to the shareholders must include the job levels benefiting from the program and the quantity of shares allocated to each job level.
3 - The Employee Stock Option <orig>خيار شراء الأسهم للموظفين</orig> plan and its program shall be presented to the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> for approval.
### Article (13) of the Articles of Association after Amendment
The shareholder's right to dispose of their shares is restricted by one or both of the following restrictions: -
1 - Requiring a right of first refusal for the Company's shareholders to purchase shares that their owner wishes to sell.
2 - Requiring the Board of Directors' <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> approval of the share buyer.
Dispositions referred to in Article (172) of this Law are exempted from these two restrictions.
Before disposing of their shares, the shareholder must notify the Company of the intention to sell. The disposition of shares shall not be effective until ten days have passed from the date of notification without any shareholder submitting a request to purchase the shares. If a shareholder submits a request to purchase the shares, it must be done at the price stated in the terms of sale.
Without prejudice to the provisions regarding the Company's purchase of its own shares, if the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> rejects the buyer, it must purchase the shares for the Company's account within ten days from the date the Board is notified of the approval request. In this case, the purchase shall be at the price at which the shareholder agreed to sell their shares.
### Article (14) of the Articles of Association before Amendment
The Company shall be managed by a Board of Directors <orig>مجلس إدارة</orig> composed of (3) three members elected by the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> by secret ballot.
### Article (14) of the Articles of Association after Amendment
The Company shall be managed by a Board of Directors <orig>مجلس إدارة</orig> whose formation, number of members, and term of membership are specified in the Company's Articles of Association. The number of Board members shall not be less than five, and the term of membership shall be three years, renewable. If a new Board of Directors <orig>مجلس إدارة</orig> cannot be elected within the specified period, the existing Board shall continue to manage the Company's affairs until the reasons cease to exist and a new Board is elected.
### Article (15) of the Articles of Association before Amendment
The term of membership of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> is three years, renewable.
### Article (15) of the Articles of Association after Amendment
Shareholders shall elect the members of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> by secret ballot. The Company's Articles of Association may stipulate the election of a number not exceeding half of the Board of Directors' <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> members.

### Article (25) of the Company's Articles of Association before Amendment
The total of these remunerations shall not exceed ten percent of the net profit after deducting depreciation and reserves and distributing a profit of not less than five percent of the capital to shareholders or any higher percentage stipulated in the company's contract.
An annual remuneration not exceeding six thousand dinars may be distributed to the Chairman of the Board of Directors, and to each member of this Board, from whichever of them calls for the meeting.

The provisions related to the procedures for calling the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig>, quorum for attendance, and voting, as stipulated for the Constituent Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> in Companies Law No. 25 of 2012, shall apply.

### Article (29) of the Articles of Association after Amendment
The Annual Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية السنوية</orig> shall convene upon an invitation from the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> within three months following the end of the financial year, at the time and place specified by the company's articles of incorporation. The Board <orig>المجلس</orig> may call the Assembly <orig>الجمعية</orig> to a meeting whenever necessary. The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> must issue an invitation for the Assembly <orig>الجمعية</orig> to meet upon a reasoned request from a number of shareholders <orig>المساهمين</orig> owning no less than ten percent of the company's capital, or upon a request from the auditor <orig>مراقب الحسابات</orig>, within 21 days from the date of the request. The inviting party shall prepare the agenda and arrange for the Secretary of the Board of Directors <orig>أمين سر مجلس الإدارة</orig>.
In closed joint-stock companies <orig>الشركات المساهمة المقفلة</orig>, the Chairman of the General Assembly <orig>رئيس الجمعية العامة</orig>, the Secretary of the Board of Directors <orig>أمين سر مجلس الإدارة</orig>, and one of the minority shareholders <orig>المساهمين</orig> present shall record the resolutions of the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> and any reservations of the shareholders <orig>المساهمين</orig>, if any, endorse them, and submit a report on these resolutions and reservations to the Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig>.
The provisions related to the procedures for calling the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig>, quorum for attendance, and voting, as stipulated for the Constituent Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> in Companies Law No. 1 of 2016, shall apply.

### Article (30) of the Company's Articles of Association before Amendment
In cases where the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> may be convened upon the request of shareholders <orig>المساهمين</orig>, auditors <orig>مراقبي الحسابات</orig>, or the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>, the agenda shall be set based on the request for the Assembly's <orig>الجمعية</orig> convening, and no matter not included in the agenda may be discussed.

### Article (30) of the Articles of Association after Amendment
The Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig> must call the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> to a meeting within fifteen days if the invitation for the Assembly's <orig>الجمعية</orig> meeting was not issued by the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> for any reason in cases where the Board <orig>المجلس</orig> is required to call the Assembly <orig>الجمعية</orig> to a meeting.
The Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig> shall replace the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> in taking the necessary procedures for holding the meeting, and it may chair the meeting, unless the Assembly <orig>الجمعية</orig> elects one of the shareholders <orig>المساهمين</orig> for this purpose.

### Article (31) of the Company's Articles of Association before Amendment
Each shareholder <orig>مساهم</orig> shall have a number of votes equal to the number of his shares. Proxy representation is permitted for attending the meeting. Minors and interdicted persons shall be represented by their legal guardians. No member may participate in voting on his own behalf or on behalf of whom he legally represents in matters related to a special interest for him or a conflict existing between him and the company.

### Article (31) of the Articles of Association after Amendment
Each shareholder <orig>مساهم</orig>, regardless of the number of his shares, has the right to attend the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig>, and shall have a number of votes equal to the number of votes allocated to the same class of shares. A shareholder <orig>المساهم</orig> may not vote on his own behalf, or on behalf of whom he represents, or on behalf of whom he legally represents, in matters related to a special interest for him, or a conflict existing between him and the company. Any condition or resolution that violates this shall be null and void. A shareholder <orig>المساهم</orig> may appoint another person to attend. The importance of the rules governing the disclosures required in proxies for the attendance of a representative of the shareholder <orig>المساهم</orig> at the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العمومية</orig> shall be issued.
Anyone claiming a right over shares that conflicts with what is recorded in the company's shareholder register <orig>سجل مساهمي الشركة</orig> may apply to the judge of urgent matters <orig>قاضي الأمور الوقتية</orig> to issue an order on petition to deprive the disputed shares <orig>الأسهم المتنازع عليها</orig> of voting for a period specified by the judge or until the dispute is settled by the competent court <orig>المحكمة المختصة</orig>, in accordance with the procedures stipulated in the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law <orig>قانون المرافعات المدنية والتجارية</orig>.

### Article (32) of the Company's Articles of Association before Amendment
Shareholders <orig>المساهمون</orig> shall register their names in a special register prepared for this purpose at the company's headquarters at least twenty-four hours before the scheduled time for the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> meeting. The register shall include the shareholder's <orig>المساهم</orig> name, the number of shares he owns, the number of shares he represents, and the termination of their owners, along with the submission of the power of attorney <orig>سند الوكالة</orig>. Each shareholder <orig>المساهم</orig> entitled to attend the Assembly <orig>الجمعية</orig> shall be given an attendance card stating the number of votes he is entitled to in person and by proxy.

### Article (32) of the Company's Articles of Association after Amendment
The company shall have a special register kept with a clearing agency <orig>وكالة مقاصة</orig> in which the names of shareholders <orig>المساهمين</orig>, their nationalities, domiciles, the number and type of shares owned by each of them, and the value paid for each share shall be recorded.
Any changes occurring to the data recorded in the shareholder register <orig>سجل المساهمين</orig> shall be endorsed in accordance with the information received by the company or the clearing agency <orig>وكالة المقاصة</orig>. Any interested party may request the company or the clearing agency <orig>وكالة المقاصة</orig> to provide them with the data from this register.

### Article (37) of the Company's Articles of Association before Amendment
The Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة المنعقدة بصفة عادية</orig> shall be competent in all matters related to the company's affairs, except for what the law or these Articles of Association <orig>النظام</orig> reserve for the Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة بصفة غير عادية</orig> or as a Constituent Assembly <orig>جمعية تأسيسية</orig>.

### Article (37) of the Articles of Association after Amendment
Subject to the provisions of the law and the company's articles of incorporation, the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> in its annual meeting shall be competent to make decisions on matters falling within its jurisdiction, and in particular, the following:-
1- The Board of Directors' <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> report on the company's activities and financial position for the ended financial year.
2- The auditor's <orig>مراقب الحسابات</orig> report on the company's financial statements.
3- A report on any violations observed by regulatory authorities <orig>الجهات الرقابية</orig> and for which penalties were imposed on the company.
4- The company's financial statements.
5- The Board of Directors' <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> proposals regarding profit distribution.
6- Discharging the liability of the Board of Directors' <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> members.
7- Electing or dismissing members of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> or determining their remuneration.
8- Appointing the company's auditor <orig>مراقب حسابات</orig>, determining their fees, or authorizing the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> to do so.
9- Appointing the Sharia Supervisory Board <orig>هيئة الرقابة الشرعية</orig> for companies operating according to the provisions of Islamic Sharia <orig>الشريعة الإسلامية</orig>, and reviewing the report of that board.
10- Reporting on transactions that have occurred or will occur with related parties <orig>الأطراف ذات الصلة</orig>, where related parties <orig>الأطراف ذات الصلة</orig> are defined according to International Accounting Standards <orig>مبادئ المحاسبة الدولية</orig>.

### Article (38) of the Company's Articles of Association before Amendment
The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> shall submit to the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة منعقدة بصفة عادية</orig> a report containing a statement on the company's operations and its financial and economic status, the company's balance sheet, a statement of profit and loss account, a statement on the remuneration of Board of Directors' <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> members, auditors' <orig>المراقبين</orig> fees, and a proposal for profit distribution, in accordance with the provisions of the Commercial Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات التجارية</orig>.

### Article (38) of the Articles of Association after Amendment
Subject to the provisions of the law and the company's articles of incorporation, the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> in its annual meeting shall be competent to make decisions on matters falling within its jurisdiction, including the Board of Directors' <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> report on the company's activities and financial position for the ended financial year, the auditor's <orig>مراقب الحسابات</orig> report on the company's financial statements, or a report on any violations observed by regulatory authorities <orig>الجهات الرقابية</orig> and for which penalties were imposed on the company, discharging the liability of the Board of Directors' <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> members, and electing or dismissing members of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> or determining their remuneration.

### Article (40) of the Company's Articles of Association before Amendment
The Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة بصفة غير عادية</orig> shall convene upon an invitation from the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, or upon a request from shareholders <orig>مساهمين</orig> owning no less than a quarter of the company's shares. In this case, the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> must call the Assembly <orig>الجمعية</orig> within one month from the date the request is received.

### Article (40) of the Articles of Association after Amendment
The Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> shall convene upon an invitation from the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig
