If the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> fails to call the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية</orig> within the period stipulated in the preceding paragraph, the Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig> shall call for the meeting within fifteen days from the date of expiry of the period referred to in the preceding paragraph.

### Article (43) of the Company's Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي للشركة</orig> Before Amendment
The company's financial year begins on January 1st and ends on December 31st of each year, with the exception of the company's first financial year, which begins from the date of the final announcement of the company's establishment and ends on December 31st of the following year.

### Article (43) of the Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig> After Amendment
The company shall have a financial year of not less than twelve months, the beginning and end of which shall be determined by the company's memorandum of association <orig>عقد الشركة</orig>. The first financial year is an exception, starting from the date of the company's registration in the Commercial Register <orig>السجل التجاري</orig> and ending on the specified date for the end of the following financial year.
The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> shall prepare an annual report on the expired financial year, and the Executive Regulations <orig>اللائحة التنفيذية</orig> shall specify the details thereof.

### Article (44) of the Company's Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي للشركة</orig> Before Amendment
The auditor <orig>المراقب</orig> shall have the powers and obligations stipulated in the Commercial Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات التجارية</orig> and Law No. 5 of 1981 on the Practice of the Profession of Auditors <orig>قانون مزاولة مهنة مراقبي الحسابات</orig>. In particular, the auditor shall have the right to inspect all the company's books, records, and documents at any time, and to request any data deemed necessary. The auditor shall also verify the company's assets and liabilities. If unable to exercise these powers, the auditor shall state this in writing in a report submitted to the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> and presented to the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig>, and shall have the right to call the General Assembly for this purpose.

### Article (44) of the Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig> After Amendment
The auditor <orig>مراقب الحسابات</orig>, in accordance with Companies Law No. (1) of 2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم (1) لسنة 2016</orig>, shall at all times have the right to inspect all the company's books, records, and documents, and to request any data deemed necessary. The auditor shall also verify the company's assets and liabilities. If unable to exercise these rights, the auditor shall state this in writing in a report submitted to the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> and presented to the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig>, and the Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig> and the Authority <orig>الهيئة</orig> shall be notified thereof.

### Article (45) of the Company's Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي للشركة</orig> Before Amendment
The auditor <orig>المراقب</orig> shall submit a report to the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> indicating whether the balance sheet and profit and loss account are consistent with reality and honestly and clearly express the company's true financial position, whether the company maintains regular accounts, whether the inventory has been conducted according to accepted principles, whether the data contained in the Board of Directors' <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> report are consistent with what is recorded in the company's books, and whether there have been any violations of the company's regulations <orig>نظام الشركة</orig>, legal provisions <orig>الأحكام القانون</orig>, or international accounting standards <orig>المعايير المحاسبية الدولية</orig> during the financial year that affect the company's activity or financial position, stating whether these violations are still ongoing, within the limits of the information available to the auditor. The auditor shall be responsible for the accuracy of the data contained in the report as an agent for all shareholders <orig>المساهمين</orig>, and every shareholder <orig>مساهم</orig> during the General Assembly meeting shall have the right to discuss the auditor and seek clarification on what is stated in the report.

### Article (45) of the Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig> After Amendment
The auditor <orig>مراقب الحسابات</orig>, or any accountant delegated by the auditor who participated in the audit work, shall attend the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> meetings and submit a report on the company's financial statements, and whether these statements show the company's financial position at the end of the financial year and the results of the company's operations for that year, and whether the data contained in the Board of Directors' <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> report are consistent with what is recorded in the company's books and documents, in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles <orig>المبادئ المحاسبية المتعارف عليها</orig> and the provisions of the law <orig>القانون</orig>.
If the company has more than one auditor <orig>مراقب للحسابات</orig>, they shall prepare a unified report. In case of disagreement among them on certain matters, this must be stated in the report, along with each auditor's point of view.

The report must, in particular, include the following data:-
1- Whether the auditor <orig>المراقب</orig> has obtained the information deemed necessary for the performance of their duties.
2- Whether the balance sheet and profit and loss accounts are consistent with reality, include all that is stipulated by law <orig>القانون</orig> and the company's memorandum of association <orig>عقد الشركة</orig>, and honestly and clearly express the company's true financial position.
3- Whether the company maintains regular accounts.
4- Whether the inventory has been conducted according to accepted principles.
5- Whether the data contained in the Board of Directors' <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> report are consistent with what is recorded in the company's books.
6- Whether there have been any violations of the provisions of the law <orig>القانون</orig> or the company's memorandum of association <orig>عقد الشركة</orig> during the financial year, stating whether these violations are still ongoing, within the limits of the information available to the auditor.
7- Any other data specified by the Executive Regulations <orig>اللائحة التنفيذية</orig>.

### Article (46) of the Company's Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي للشركة</orig> Before Amendment
A percentage, determined by the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, shall be deducted from the gross non-net profits for the depreciation of the company's assets or to compensate for their decrease in value. These funds shall be used to purchase necessary materials, machinery, and facilities or for their repair, and these funds may not be distributed to shareholders <orig>المساهمين</orig>.
Net profits shall be distributed as follows:-
1- Ten percent (10%) shall be deducted and allocated to the statutory reserve <orig>الاحتياطي الإجباري</orig>, unless the Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig> specify a higher percentage. The General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> may cease this deduction if the statutory reserve exceeds half of the company's capital.
2- One percent (1%) shall be deducted and allocated to the Kuwait Foundation for the Advancement of Sciences <orig>مؤسسة الكويت للتقدم العلمي</orig>.
3- A percentage shall be deducted and allocated to the optional reserve <orig>الاحتياطي الإختياري</orig>, as proposed by the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> and approved by the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig>. This deduction shall be ceased by a resolution of the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العادية</orig> based on a proposal from the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>.
4- A portion of the profits shall be deducted, based on a proposal from the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> and approved by the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig>, to meet the company's obligations under labor laws <orig>قوانين العمل</orig>. These funds may not be distributed to shareholders <orig>المساهمين</orig>.
5- The amount necessary for the distribution of a first dividend of five percent (5%) to shareholders <orig>المساهمين</orig> shall be deducted, as determined by the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> and approved by the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig>.
6- After the foregoing, an amount determined by the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig>, not exceeding ten percent (10%) of the remainder, shall be deducted and allocated as remuneration for the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>.
7- The remaining profits shall then be distributed to shareholders <orig>المساهمين</orig> as an additional share in profits, or carried forward to the next year based on a proposal from the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, or allocated to establish a general reserve fund <orig>مال احتياطي عام</orig> or an extraordinary depreciation fund <orig>مال للاستهلاك غير عاديين</orig>.

### Article 46 of the Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig> After Amendment
Annually, by a resolution issued by the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> based on a proposal from the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, a percentage of not less than ten percent (10%) of the net profits shall be deducted to form a statutory reserve <orig>إحتياطي إجباري</orig> for the company.
The General Assembly <orig>الجمعية</orig> may cease this deduction if the statutory reserve <orig>الإحتياطي الإجباري</orig> exceeds half of the company's issued capital.
The statutory reserve <orig>الإحتياطي الإجباري</orig> may only be used to cover the company's losses or to ensure the distribution of dividends to shareholders <orig>المساهمين</orig> at a rate not exceeding five percent (5%) of the paid-up capital <orig>رأس المال المدفوع</orig> in years when the company's profits do not allow for the distribution of this percentage, due to the absence of an optional reserve <orig>إحتياطي إختياري</orig> that would permit the distribution of this percentage of profits.
What has been deducted from the statutory reserve <orig>الإحتياطي الإجباري</orig> must be restored to it when the profits of subsequent years allow, unless this reserve exceeds half of the issued capital.

### Article 48 of the Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig> Before Amendment
Dividends <orig>حصص الأرباح</orig> shall be paid to shareholders <orig>المساهمين</orig> at the place and times determined by the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>.

*   Representing Gulf Securities Depository Company <orig>الشركة الخليجية لحفظ الأوراق المالية</orig>: Mr. Omar Osama Al-Zawawi <orig>عمر أسامة الزواوي</orig>
*   Mr. Ahmed Ismail Yousef <orig>أحمد إسماعيل يوسف</orig>, authorized by Mr. Qais Mohammed Al-Nisf <orig>قيس محمد النصف</orig> – BDO Al-Nisf & Partners <orig>النصف وشركاه</orig>, Independent Auditor.
After the legal quorum of 93.8272% was met for the Extraordinary General Assembly meeting, Mr. Mohammed Fahad Al-Duwaihees <orig>محمد فهاد الدوييهس</orig> opened the meeting, welcoming the attendees and thanking them for accepting the invitation. He then began discussing the agenda as follows:
First: Considering the future of the Company:
The Chairman of the Board of Directors, Mr. Mohammed Fahad Al-Duwaihees <orig>محمد فهاد الدوييهس</orig>, clarified the Company's situation and reported the Board of Directors' recommendation for liquidation. The attendees unanimously approved the recommendation and the liquidation of the Company.
Second: Appointing a liquidator and determining their fees and the duration of liquidation:
The appointment of Mr. Ahmed Tawfiq Al-Rasheed <orig>أحمد توفيق الرشيد</orig> as the Company's liquidator was unanimously approved. His fees were set at an amount of (2500 K.D. <orig>د.ك</orig>), and the liquidation period shall be one year.
At the end of the meeting, Mr. Mohammed Fahad Al-Duwaihees <orig>محمد فهاد الدوييهس</orig>, in his capacity as Chairman of the session, thanked the attendees, and the meeting concluded at 12:00 PM.
Chairman of the Board of Directors

# Article 48 of the Articles of Association after Amendment
. Subject to the provisions contained in the Company's Articles of Incorporation, the Ordinary General Assembly may, based on a proposal from the Board of Directors, distribute profits to shareholders at the end of the fiscal year or the end of each financial period. For this distribution to be valid, it must be from real profits, in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles, and must not affect the Company's paid-up capital.
# Article 49 of the Articles of Association before Amendment
. The reserve fund shall be used based on a decision by the Board of Directors in a manner that best serves the Company's interests. The mandatory reserve may not be distributed to shareholders, but it may be used to ensure the distribution of profits to shareholders up to (5%) five percent in years when the Company's profits do not allow for securing this limit. If the mandatory reserve exceeds half of the Company's capital, the General Assembly may decide to use the excess amount for purposes it deems beneficial to the Company and its shareholders.
# Article 49 of the Articles of Association after Amendment
. Annually, a percentage, determined by the Company's Articles of Incorporation or the Board of Directors, after consulting the auditor, shall be deducted from the non-net profits for the depreciation of the Company's assets or compensation for their decrease in value. These funds shall be used to purchase necessary materials, machinery, and facilities or to repair them, and these funds may not be distributed to shareholders.
. The Ordinary General Assembly must decide to deduct a percentage of profits to meet the Company's obligations under labor and social insurance laws.
. The Company's Articles of Incorporation may stipulate the establishment of a special fund to assist the Company's workers and employees.
. Annually, by a decision issued by the Ordinary General Assembly based on a proposal from the Board of Directors, a percentage not exceeding ten percent of the net profits may be deducted to form an optional reserve allocated for purposes determined by the General Assembly.
# Article (52) of the Company's Articles of Association before Amendment
The liquidation of the Company shall be carried out in the manner governed by Companies Law No. 25 of 2012 <orig>قانون الشركات 25 لسنة 2012</orig>, its amendments, and its executive regulations.
# Article (52) of the Company's Articles of Association after Amendment
Upon its dissolution, the Company enters the liquidation phase. During the liquidation period, the Company retains its legal personality to the extent necessary to complete the liquidation. The phrase "Under Liquidation" must be added to the Company's name, written in clear letters, in all correspondence issued by it. The liquidation of the Company shall follow the provisions stipulated in the following articles and what is otherwise stipulated in the Company's Articles of Incorporation.
# Article 53 of the Articles of Association before Amendment
The provisions of Companies Law No. 25 of 2012 <orig>الشركات رقم 25 لسنة 2012</orig>, its amendments, and its executive regulations shall apply to all matters not specifically provided for in the Articles of Incorporation or in these Articles.
# Article 53 of the Articles of Association after Amendment
The provisions of Companies Law No. 1 of 2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 1 لسنة 2016</orig>, its amendments, and its executive regulations shall apply to all matters not specifically provided for in the Articles of Incorporation or in these Articles.
The meeting concluded at 12:00 PM, and all the aforementioned amendments were approved.
Chairman of the Board of Directors

The purposes for which the Company was established are as follows:

Article text after amendment:
Second: Articles of Association:
Approval of the amendment to Article No. (8) of the Articles of Association
Article text before amendment: The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> shall deliver to each shareholder, within three months from the date of the company's establishment announcement, eight share certificates stating the number of subscribed shares and the amounts paid.
Article text after amendment: Securities issued by the company shall be subject to the central securities depository system at the Kuwait Clearing Company / Wakalat Al-Maqasa <orig>وكالة المقاصة</orig>. The receipt of depositing securities with the Kuwait Clearing Company / Wakalat Al-Maqasa <orig>وكالة المقاصة</orig> shall be considered a title deed for the security. Each owner shall be given a receipt for the number of securities they own.
Approval of the amendment to Article No. (15) of the Articles of Association
Article text before amendment: The term of membership of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> is three years, renewable.
Article text after amendment: The term of membership of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> is three years, renewable. If a new Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> cannot be elected on time, the existing Board shall continue to manage the company's affairs until the reasons cease to exist and a new Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> is elected.
Approval of the amendment to Article No. (16) of the Articles of Association
Article text before amendment: A member of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> must not have been convicted of a crime against honor, and must own shares in the company not less than (1) percent of the company's capital, provided that it is sufficient for the member to own shares whose nominal value is equivalent to seven thousand five hundred Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>, unless the company's articles of association stipulate otherwise. This amount of shares shall be allocated as a guarantee for the member's management, and must be deposited within one month from the date of appointment with an accredited bank. The deposit shall continue, and the shares shall not be tradable, until the end of the membership term and the approval of the financial statements for the last fiscal year in which the member performed their duties. If the member fails to provide the guarantee as mentioned, their membership shall be nullified.
Article text after amendment: In accordance with Law No. 1/2016 <orig>القانون رقم 2016/1</orig>, the following conditions must be met by anyone nominated for membership in the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>:
1. Must possess legal capacity.
2. Must not have been previously convicted of a felony with a custodial sentence, or a crime of bankruptcy due to negligence or fraud, or a crime against honor or trust, or a custodial sentence for violating the provisions of this law, unless their reputation has been restored.
3. Except for independent Board members, must personally own, or the person they represent must own, a number of the company's shares.
If a member of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> loses any of the aforementioned conditions or other conditions stipulated in Law No. (1) of 2016 <orig>القانون رقم (1) لسنة 2016</orig> and its amendments or other laws, their membership shall cease from the date of losing that condition.

**Text of the Article after Amendment:** The Board of Directors shall meet at least six times during the year, unless the company's articles of association stipulate more frequent meetings. A meeting of the Board of Directors shall not be valid unless attended by at least half of the members who have the right to vote. The meeting may be held using modern communication methods, and decisions may be taken by circulation with the approval of all Board members. The Board of Directors must meet at least six times.

### Approval of the Amendment to Article No. (23) of the Articles of Association

**Text of the Article before Amendment:** Decisions of the Board of Directors shall be issued by the majority of those present. If votes are tied, the side with the Chairman shall prevail. A special register shall be kept to record the minutes of the Board's sessions, and a dissenting member may request that their opinion be recorded.

**Text of the Article after Amendment:** Decisions of the Board of Directors shall be issued by the majority of those present. If votes are tied, the side with the Chairman shall prevail. The Board of Directors shall appoint a secretary who shall record all proceedings of the Board of Directors' meetings in minutes. A special register shall be kept to record these minutes, and the minutes of the Board of Directors' meetings shall be signed by the Board's secretary and all attending members. A dissenting member may request that their opinion be recorded in the meeting minutes.

### Approval of the Amendment to Article No. (24) of the Articles of Association

**Text of the Article before Amendment:** If a member of the Board of Directors fails to attend three consecutive sessions without a legitimate excuse, they may be considered resigned by a decision of the Board of Directors.

**Text of the Article after Amendment:** If a member of the Board of Directors fails to attend four consecutive sessions without a legitimate excuse, they may be considered resigned by a decision of the Board of Directors.

### Approval of the Amendment to Article No. (25) of the Articles of Association

**Text of the Article before Amendment:** Without prejudice to the provisions of the Commercial Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات التجارية</orig>, the Ordinary General Assembly shall determine the remuneration of the members of the Board of Directors.

**Text of the Article after Amendment:** The remuneration of the Board of Directors shall be determined such that their total does not exceed ten percent of the company's net profit after deducting depreciation and reserves and distributing a profit of not less than five percent of the capital to shareholders (a higher percentage may be agreed upon). An annual remuneration not exceeding six thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> may be distributed to the Chairman of the Board of Directors and each member of the Board from the date of the company's establishment until the achievement of profits that allow for the distribution of remuneration in accordance with the preceding paragraph. By a decision issued by the company's Ordinary General Assembly, a resigning Board member may be exempted from the aforementioned maximum remuneration (if the company has independent members). The Board of Directors is obligated to submit an annual report to the Ordinary General Assembly for approval of the amounts and benefits received by the Board members in detail.

### Approval of the Amendment to Article No. (26) of the Articles of Association

**Text of the Article before Amendment:** The Board of Directors shall have the broadest powers to manage the company and carry out all actions required for the company's management in accordance with its purposes. This authority shall only be limited by what is stipulated by law, these Articles, or the decisions of the General Assembly. The Board of Directors may not sell or mortgage the company's real estate, issue guarantees, or contract loans except after the approval of the General Assembly.

**Text of the Article after Amendment:** The Board of Directors shall have the broadest powers to manage the company and carry out all actions required for the company's management in accordance with its purposes. This authority shall only be limited by what is stipulated by law, these Articles, or the decisions of the General Assembly. The Board of Directors may sell or mortgage the company's real estate, issue guarantees, contract loans, settle disputes, arbitrate, or make donations.

### Approval of the Amendment to Article No. (28) of the Articles of Association

Text of the Article after Amendment: The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> shall submit to the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> a report containing a statement on the company's operations, its financial and economic status, the company's budget, a statement of profit and loss accounts, a statement on the remuneration of Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> members, auditors' fees, and a proposal for profit distribution, in accordance with the provisions of Companies Law No. 1 of 2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 1 لسنة 2016</orig>, its amendments, and its executive regulations.

## Approval of the Amendment of Article No. (39) of the Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig>
Text of the Article before Amendment: The Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> shall ordinarily discuss the report of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> and decide what it deems appropriate regarding it, consider the auditors' report and the report of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>, if any. It shall elect the members of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> and appoint the auditors for the coming year and determine their fees in accordance with the provisions of the Commercial Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات التجارية</orig>.
Text of the Article after Amendment: Subject to the provisions of the law, the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> in its annual meeting shall be competent to take decisions on matters falling within its jurisdiction, and in particular the following:
1. The Board of Directors' <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> report on the company's activity and financial position for the ended financial year.
2. The auditor's report for the ended financial year.
3. A report on any violations observed by regulatory bodies <orig>الجهات الرقابية</orig> and for which penalties were imposed on the company.
4. The company's financial statements.
5. The Board of Directors' <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> proposals regarding profit distribution.
6. Discharge of the Board of Directors' <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> members.
7. Election or dismissal of Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> members, and determination of their remuneration.
8. Appointment of an auditor for the company, and determination of their fees or delegation of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> to do so.
9. A report on transactions that have occurred or will occur with related parties in accordance with International Accounting Standards <orig>مبادئ المحاسبة الدولية</orig>.

## Approval of the Amendment of Article No. (40) of the Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig>
Text of the Article before Amendment: The General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> shall convene in an extraordinary session upon an invitation from the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, or upon a request from shareholders owning no less than a quarter of the company's shares. In this case, the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> must invite the Assembly within one month from the date the request is received.
Text of the Article after Amendment: The Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> shall convene upon an invitation from the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, or upon a reasoned request from shareholders representing fifteen percent of the company's issued capital or from the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>. The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> must invite the Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> to a meeting within thirty days from the date of submitting the request. If the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> fails to invite the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> within the period stipulated in the preceding paragraph, the Ministry <orig>الوزارة</orig> shall issue the invitation for the meeting within fifteen days from the expiry date referred to in the preceding paragraph.

## Approval of the Amendment of Article No. (41) of the Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig>
Text of the Article before Amendment: The following matters shall only be considered by the Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة المنعقدة بصفة غير عادية</orig>:
1. Amendment of the company's memorandum of association <orig>عقد التأسيس</orig> or articles of association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig>.
2. Sale of the entire project undertaken by the company or its disposal in any other way.
3. Dissolution, merger, transformation, or division of the company.
4. Increase or decrease of the company's capital.
- Any resolution issued by the Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> shall not be effective until publication procedures <orig>إجراءات الشهر</orig> are taken. The approval of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> must be obtained if the resolution relates to the company's name, its objectives, or its capital. Except for increasing capital by issuing shares against profits achieved by the company or as a result of adding reserves, which are eligible for use, to the capital. Any amendment to the company's regulations shall not be effective until approved by the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>.
Text of the Article after Amendment: Subject to other competencies stipulated by law, the Extraordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة غير العادية</orig> shall be competent for the following matters:
1. Amendment of the company's memorandum of association <orig>عقد الشركة</orig>.

## Approval of the Amendment of Article No. (42) of the Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig>
Text of the Article before Amendment: The company shall have one or more auditors <orig>مراقب حسابات</orig> from among chartered accountants <orig>المحاسبين القانونيين</orig>, appointed by the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig>, which shall determine their fees. The auditor shall monitor the accounts for the financial year for which they were appointed.
Text of the Article after Amendment: The company shall have one or more auditors <orig>مراقب حسابات</orig> appointed by the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig>. In exceptional and emergency cases where the auditor appointed by the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> does not perform their duties for any reason, the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> may appoint a replacement, provided that this matter is presented at the first meeting held by the Assembly for decision.

## Approval of the Amendment of Article No. (46) of the Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig>
Text of the Article before Amendment: A percentage, determined by the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, shall be deducted from the gross non-net profits for the depreciation of the company's assets or to compensate for their decrease in value. These funds shall be used to purchase necessary materials, machinery, and facilities or to repair them, and these funds may not be distributed to shareholders.
Text of the Article after Amendment: A percentage, determined by the company's memorandum of association <orig>عقد الشركة</orig> or the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> after consulting the auditor <orig>مراقب الحسابات</orig>, shall be deducted from the gross non-net profits for the depreciation of the company's assets or to compensate for their decrease in value. These funds shall be used to purchase necessary materials, machinery, and facilities or to repair them, and these funds may not be distributed to shareholders.

## Approval of the Amendment of Article No. (47) of the Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig>
Text of the Article before Amendment: The net profits shall be distributed as follows:
1. Ten percent (10%) shall be deducted and allocated to the statutory reserve <orig>الاحتياطي الإجباري</orig>, unless the Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig> specify a higher percentage. The General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> may cease this deduction if the statutory reserve <orig>الاحتياطي الإجباري</orig> exceeds half of the company's capital.
2. One percent (1%) shall be deducted and allocated to the Kuwait Foundation for the Advancement of Sciences <orig>مؤسسة الكويت للتقدم العلمي</orig>.
3. A percentage shall be deducted and allocated to the optional reserve <orig>الاحتياطي الاختياري</orig>, proposed by the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> and approved by the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig>. This deduction shall cease by a resolution of the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العادية</orig> based on a proposal from the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>.
4. A portion of the profits shall be deducted, based on a proposal from the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> and approved by the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig>, to meet the company's obligations under labor laws. These funds may not be distributed to shareholders.
5. The amount necessary to distribute a first dividend of 5% (five percent) to shareholders shall be deducted, as determined by the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> and approved by the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig>.
6. After the foregoing, an amount determined by the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig>, not exceeding 10% (ten percent) of the remainder, shall be deducted and allocated as remuneration for the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>.
7. The remaining profits shall then be distributed to shareholders as an additional share in profits, or carried forward to the next year based on a proposal from the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, or allocated to establish a general reserve fund or an extraordinary depreciation fund.
Text of the Article after Amendment: The net profits shall be distributed as follows:
First: Annually, by a resolution issued by the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> based on a proposal from the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, a percentage of not less than ten percent of the net profits shall be deducted to form a statutory reserve <orig>احتياطي إجباري</orig> for the company.
The Assembly <orig>الجمعية</orig> may cease this deduction if the statutory reserve <orig>الاحتياطي الإجباري</orig> exceeds half of the company's issued capital.

### Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting
### Held on 2025/05/11

The Extraordinary General Assembly of Aman Takaful Insurance Company <orig>أمان للتأمين التكافلي</orig> K.S.C. (Closed) <orig>ش.م.ك (مقفلة)</orig> was held on Sunday, 2025/05/11, at 11:00 AM at the company's headquarters located in Sharq <orig>الشرق</orig> area - Ahmed Al-Jaber <orig>أحمد الجابر</orig> Street - Gravity <orig>جرافتي</orig> Tower – 13th Floor.
The meeting was chaired by Mr. Eid Salman Matar Al-Shammari <orig>عيد سلمان مطر الشمري</orig> – Chairman of the Board of Directors.

The following attended the meeting:
*   Mr. Hussein Ali Al-Hadi Abu Al-Futouh <orig>حسين علي الهادي أبو الفتوح</orig> – Board Secretary.
*   Shareholders holding 42,000,000 shares, in person and by proxy, representing 84% of the total share capital of the company, which amounts to 50,000,000 shares.

After announcing the availability of the legal quorum for the validity of the Extraordinary General Assembly meeting, the Chairman of the session opened the meeting, welcoming the attendees. He then proceeded to present and discuss the items on the agenda of the Extraordinary General Assembly and the time for approving and ratifying them, which are as follows:

**First: Approval of the amendment to the text of Article No. (14) of the Company's Articles of Association as follows:**
**Text before amendment:**
The company shall be managed by a Board of Directors consisting of (5) members elected by the General Assembly by secret ballot.
**Text after amendment:**
The company shall be managed by a Board of Directors consisting of five members, and the number of independent board members shall not be less than two and shall not exceed half of the total board members.

**Second: Approval of the amendment to the text of Article No. (15) of the Company's Articles of Association as follows:**
**Text before amendment:**
The term of membership of the Board of Directors is three years, renewable.
**Text after amendment:**
The term of membership of the Board of Directors is three years, renewable. If it is not possible to elect a new Board of Directors within the specified period, the existing Board shall continue to manage the company's affairs until the reasons cease to exist and a new Board of Directors is elected.

**Third: Approval of the amendment to the text of Article No. (16) of the Company's Articles of Association as follows:**
**Text before amendment:**
A member of the Board of Directors must not have been convicted of a crime against honor and must own shares in the company not less than 1% of the company's capital, provided that it is sufficient for the member to own shares equivalent to seven thousand five hundred Kuwaiti Dinars. All this is unless the company's regulations stipulate another amount. This amount of shares is allocated to guarantee the member's management and must be deposited within one month from the date of the member's appointment with accredited banks, and it shall remain deposited and non-tradable until the end of the membership term and the approval of the balance sheet for the last financial year in which the member performed his duties. If the member does not provide the guarantee as mentioned, his membership shall be void.

**Text after amendment:**
The following conditions must be met by anyone nominated for membership of the Board of Directors:
1- Must have legal capacity to act.
2- Must not have been previously convicted of a felony with a custodial sentence, or a crime of bankruptcy due to negligence or fraud, or a crime against honor or trust, or a custodial sentence for violating the provisions of this law, unless his reputation has been restored.
3- Except for independent board members, must personally own or be represented by shares in the company. If a board member loses any of the aforementioned conditions, his membership shall cease.
Accordingly, at the end of the meeting, the Chairman of the session extended his sincere thanks to the attendees, wishing them and the company success. The meeting concluded at 12:00 PM on the same day.

### Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting

On Sunday, 2025/05/11 AD, at 12:30 PM, the meeting was held with the presence of Mr. Ali Mohammed Ali Al-Dukhan <orig>علي محمد علي الدخان</orig> and Mr. Nasser Saud Al-Manea <orig>ناصر سعود المنيع</orig> (representative of Gulf Company for Securities Custody <orig>الشركة الخليجية لحفظ الأوراق المالية</orig>) via ZOOM.
The quorum percentage reached 90.00%, and the following was done:

**First: Approval was given to amend Article (5) of the Memorandum of Association and Article (4) of the Articles of Association.**

**Activities before amendment**
1.  Management and ownership of cinemas in the State of Kuwait and abroad, their operation and exploitation, import, export, rental, sale, production, and distribution of films of all types and sizes.
2.  Import of all necessary machinery and equipment for the cinema industry, trading in them, raw films, photographic equipment, display equipment, and the sale of everything that may be included or used for the cinema industry.
3.  Entering into all governmental or private tenders that fall within its purposes.
4.  Has the right to agree with theatrical, musical, and entertainment groups inside and outside Kuwait to hold parties, provided that their presence does not conflict with the country's laws and regulations.
5.  Renting cinemas to governmental and private bodies for these bodies to hold parties.
6.  The company is generally concerned with everything related to cinema and its accessories in terms of cultural, entertainment, and intellectual activities in Kuwait and abroad.
7.  Exploiting the financial surpluses available to the company by investing them in financial portfolios managed by specialized companies and entities (after the approval of the Ministry of Information). The company may directly carry out the aforementioned activities in the State of Kuwait and abroad, either as a principal or by agency. The company may have an interest or participate in any way with entities engaged in similar activities or that may assist it in achieving its objectives in Kuwait or abroad, and it may establish, participate in, purchase, or annex these entities.

Text before amendment:
Subject to the provisions of the law, the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> at its annual meeting shall be competent to take decisions on matters falling within its jurisdiction, and in particular the following:
1. The Board of Directors' <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> report on the company's activity and financial position for the ended financial year.
2. The auditor's report on the company's financial statements.
3. A report on any violation detected by supervisory authorities for which penalties were imposed on the company.
4. The company's financial statements.
5. The Board of Directors' <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> proposals regarding profit distribution.
6. Discharging the liability of the Board of Directors' <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> members.
7. Electing or dismissing members of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, and determining their remunerations.
8. Appointing the company's auditor, and determining his fees or authorizing the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> to do so.

10. Appointing the Sharia Fatwa and Supervision Board <orig>هيئة الفتوى والرقابة الشرعية</orig>, and determining the fees of its members or authorizing the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> to do so.
Report on transactions that have occurred or will occur with related parties, where related parties are defined according to International Accounting Principles.
This item was approved by all shareholders present in person and through electronic voting.
Sixth: Approval of adding new articles to the Company's Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig> as follows:
1. Approval of adding Article No. (59) to the Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig>, which stipulates the following:
The purposes for which the company was established must be exercised in accordance with the provisions of Islamic Sharia <orig>الشريعة الإسلامية</orig>, and under no circumstances shall any of the purposes specified in Article (5) of the Memorandum of Association <orig>عقد التأسيس</orig> and Article No. (4) of the Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig> be interpreted as permitting the company to directly engage in any usurious acts or acts contrary to the provisions of Islamic Sharia <orig>الشريعة الإسلامية</orig>.
2. Approval of adding Article No. (60) to the Articles of Association <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig>, which stipulates the following:
The company shall form an independent body called the (Sharia Supervisory Board <orig>هيئة الرقابة الشرعية</orig>), consisting of a number of specialists in the principles of Islamic jurisprudence <orig>أصول الفقه الإسلامي</orig> holding at least a university degree in this field, whose number shall not be less than three, appointed by the Company's General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig>.
Its competencies are as follows:
- Expressing Islamic Sharia opinion on the company's activities and actions.
- Verifying the company's compliance with the provisions of Islamic Sharia <orig>الشريعة الإسلامية</orig>.
- Submitting an annual report to the Company's General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> including its opinion on the extent of compliance of the company's operations, activities, and actions with the provisions of Islamic Sharia <orig>الشريعة الإسلامية</orig>, the extent of the company's management's commitment to the opinions expressed by the Sharia Supervisory Board <orig>هيئة الرقابة الشرعية</orig> in this regard, and any observations it may have on the company's operations.
Opinions shall be taken by majority. In the event that a majority cannot be achieved and there is a disagreement among the members of the Sharia Board <orig>الهيئة الشرعية</orig> regarding a Sharia ruling, the disputed matter shall be referred to the Fatwa Department of the Ministry of Awqaf and Islamic Affairs <orig>هيئة الفتوى بوزارة الأوقاف والشئون الإسلامية</orig>.
This item was approved by all shareholders present in person and through electronic voting.
The meeting concluded at 10:20 AM.

In all cases, the nominal value of the additional shares shall be equal to the nominal value of the original shares.
If it is decided to increase capital by offering shares for public subscription, shareholders shall have the right of priority to subscribe to the new shares in proportion to their respective holdings, within fifteen days from the date of their notification thereof. ## Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting
On Monday, May 12, 2025, at 12:30 PM, at the liquidator's office located in Sharq <orig>شرق</orig> Area, Block 4, Dasman <orig>دسمان</orig> Complex, 9th Floor, Block 2 B.

With the attendance of shareholders representing 75.4% of the company's total shares, amounting to 17,723,693 proxy shares, and in the presence of the company's liquidator, Mr. Abdul Rahman Al-Hassawi <orig>عبد الرحمن الحساوي</orig> from Roedl Middle East Burgan <orig>رودل الشرق الأوسط برقان</orig> Chartered Accountants. Also present were the authorized representatives for the Extraordinary General Assembly.

The Extraordinary General Assembly of Marwa International Real Estate Company K.S.C. <orig>مروة العالمية العقارية ش.م.ك</orig> (Under Liquidation) was held, and the following was resolved:
*   Setting a liquidation period of two years. This was approved.
*   Re-appointing Mr. Abdul Rahman Al-Hassawi <orig>عبد الرحمن الحساوي</orig> as the company's liquidator. His fees were set at KWD 250 <orig>250 د.ك</orig> per month, and this was approved.

The meeting concluded at 12:40 PM. The liquidator thanked the attendees, wishing them utmost respect.

## Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting
Held on Sunday, May 04, 2025
Based on Board of Directors Meeting No. 2024/2 held on December 02, 2024, and the invitation issued by the Chairman of the Board of Directors to attend the Extraordinary General Assembly meeting to discuss the agenda items, the Extraordinary General Assembly meeting was held on Sunday, May 04, 2025, at 9:00 AM, via the electronic system, after voting was opened on Thursday, April 24, 2025, through the company's electronic system for shareholders. Shareholders representing 9,900,000 shares, both in person and by proxy, were present, constituting 99% of the company's total capital of KWD 1,000,000 <orig>1,000,000 دينار كويتي</orig>. The completion of the legal quorum required for the valid convening of the Extraordinary General Assembly was announced, followed by the reading of the agenda items for discussion. The Extraordinary General Assembly issued its approval regarding the following resolutions:
**Item One:** – Voting on the amendment of Article 27 of the Company's Articles of Association (Board of Directors) according to the following wording:
### Text Before Amendment:
Article 27- A- Board of Directors – The company shall be managed by a Board of Directors consisting of (6) members. The term of membership shall be three years, renewable. If it is not possible to elect a new Board of Directors within the specified period, the existing Board shall continue to manage the company's affairs until the reasons cease and a new Board of Directors is elected.
### Text After Amendment:
"Article 27- A- Board of Directors – The company shall be managed by a Board of Directors consisting of five (5) members. The term of membership shall be three years, renewable. If it is not possible to elect a new Board of Directors within the specified period, the existing Board shall continue to manage the company's affairs until the reasons cease and a new Board of Directors is elected."
**Item Two:** – Voting on the amendment of Article 33 of the Company's Articles of Association.
### Text Before Amendment:
A Board of Directors meeting shall not be valid unless attended by half of the members, provided that the number of attendees is not less than four. A higher percentage or number may be agreed upon. Meetings may be held using modern communication methods, and decisions may be passed by circulation with the approval of all Board members.
The Board of Directors must meet at least six times during the year, and a greater number of meetings may be agreed upon.
### Text After Amendment:
A Board of Directors meeting shall not be valid unless attended by half of the members, provided that the number of attendees is not less than three. A higher percentage or number may be agreed upon. Meetings may be held using modern communication methods, and decisions may be passed by circulation with the approval of all Board members.
The Board of Directors must meet at least six times during the year, and a greater number of meetings may be agreed upon.

Chairman of the Board of Directors

**Site Visit:** At 7:00 AM on Tuesday, 03/06/2025, at the Military Facilities Engineering Headquarters – Maidan Hawally <orig>ميدان حولي</orig>.

**Preliminary Meeting:** At 10:00 AM on Wednesday, 04/06/2025, at the Military Facilities Engineering Headquarters – Maidan Hawally <orig>ميدان حولي</orig>.

**Instructions:**
1.  The Ministry must be notified of the names, job titles, and passport copies of candidates attending the site visit seven days prior to the date. Submissions via fax will not be accepted.
2.  The tender purchase receipt must be presented when attending the site visit and preliminary meeting.
3.  Authorization letter to purchase tender documents.
4.  A certificate of national labor percentage must be submitted with the bid.
5.  The last day to purchase tender documents is 1:00 PM on Sunday, 29-06-2025.
6.  The last day for submitting bids is 1:00 PM at the Mail and Tenders Delivery Center at the Ministry (Window No. 1 – Box No. 1 – Committee for Military Material Purchases and Military Facilities Contracts for the Ministry of Defense <orig>وزارة الدفاع</orig>) next to Gate No. 12, beside the Military Sports Federation.
7.  This tender is general for companies specialized in the operation, maintenance, and repair of air conditioning and ventilation systems, mechanical equipment, sanitary tools, and electrical appliances, which meet all conditions stated in the tender documents and are registered with the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig>, and is submitted under the single envelope system.

A mandatory preliminary meeting will be held to answer inquiries from participating companies on Monday, 16/06/2025, at 10:00 AM at the General Directorate of Information Systems <orig>الإدارة العامة لنظم المعلومات</orig> headquarters. Any recommendations or decisions resulting from this meeting are considered an integral part of the practice documents and are binding on all companies, whether the practitioner attended or did not attend the mandatory preliminary meeting.

## Announcement
The Ministry of Interior <orig>وزارة الداخلية</orig> announces Practice No. (L.Sh. 2026-2025/18) for the maintenance of the identity issuance system for the General Directorate of Police Force Affairs <orig>الإدارة العامة لشئون قوة الشرطة</orig> of the General Directorate of Information Systems <orig>الإدارة العامة لنظم المعلومات</orig> – at the Ministry of Interior <orig>وزارة الداخلية</orig>.
Specialized companies/establishments in this field should refer to the General Directorate of Financial Affairs <orig>الإدارة العامة للشئون المالية</orig> (Tenders Department (at Al-Ma'aridhiya Industrial <orig>المعارضية الصناعية</orig>)) to obtain the documents for this practice for a fee of (20/-) K.D. (twenty Kuwaiti Dinars only) (via K-Net) (non-refundable). An initial guarantee of (1,600/-) K.D. (one thousand six hundred Kuwaiti Dinars only) must be submitted (to be placed in the financial bid for the practice), noting that the final insurance for the practice is (10%) of the total contract value.
Accompanied by a copy of the practice announcement in the Official Gazette (Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>), and the following documents:
- Valid registration receipt with the Ministry of Interior <orig>وزارة الداخلية</orig>.
- Or
- Registration request for registration with the Ministry and then purchasing the practice documents.
Please note that the closing date (submission of bids) is Wednesday, 18/06/2025, from 8:00 AM until 1:00 PM. No bids submitted before or after the mentioned time will be accepted. Bids must be submitted to the Bid Opening Committee of the Purchasing Committee at the Ministry of Interior <orig>وزارة الداخلية</orig> building (Sharq Area <orig>منطقة شرق</orig> – Al-Siddiq School <orig>مدرسة الصديق</orig> – First Floor).

## Announcement
**Subject:** Practice No. 2411-2754-14-243
For the maintenance and repair of a boat lifting crane (75 tons) as needed for 3 years. The Ministry of Defense <orig>وزارة الدفاع</orig> announces the offering of the aforementioned practice to specialized companies for the year 2025, in accordance with the terms and specifications contained in the practice documents, which can be obtained from the Technical Equipment Department <orig>إدارة التجهيزات الفنية</orig> – Technical Equipment Control <orig>مراقبة التجهيزات الفنية</orig> – during official working hours. Bids must be submitted at the Ministry's headquarters at 12:00 PM – Mail and Tenders Delivery Center near Gate No. (12).

# Announcement
## Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig>
The Ministry of Health <orig>وزارة الصحة</orig> announces the issuance of Tender No.: S / MS / 2026 / 2025
regarding the supply of television screens for operating the IPTV system for the new Kuwait Cancer Center <orig>مركز الكويت للسرطان الجديد</orig>.
This is in accordance with the general and special conditions outlined in the tender documents, which can be obtained from the Ministry's website (www.moh.gov.kw), for a non-refundable payment of (75 K.D.) only, seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>.
It is necessary to attach a letter from the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> when submitting the booklet, stating compliance with the National Labor Support Law <orig>قانون دعم العمالة الوطنية</orig> in accordance with Law No. 19 of 2000 and Cabinet Resolution No. 1104 (Fifth) of 2008 regarding the support and encouragement of national labor.
Please note that the closing date for the tender is at 1:00 PM on Monday, 2025/06/23, at the bids box in the General Diwan of the Ministry of Health <orig>ديوان عام وزارة الصحة</orig> (Sulaibikhat <orig>الصليبخات</orig> – Procurement Department Building – Tenders Section). Bids are valid for (90) days from the closing date, and the initial guarantee is (2%) only of the bid value, valid throughout the bid's validity period.
Note: Priority is given to owners of small and medium-sized enterprises affiliated with the National Fund for Small and Medium Enterprise Development <orig>الصندوق الوطني لتنمية المشروعات الصغيرة والمتوسطة</orig>.
Undersecretary of the Ministry of Health <orig>وكيل وزارة الصحة</orig>

The initial guarantee is (2%) for ninety (90) days from the closing date, and the initial guarantee is (2%) only during the period of honesty of the bid value, valid for the entire duration of the bid.
Note: Priority is given to owners of small and medium-sized enterprises <orig>المشاريع الصغيرة و المتوسطة</orig> affiliated with the National Fund for Small and Medium Enterprise Development <orig>الصندوق الوطني و تنمية المشروعات الصغيرة و المتوسطة</orig>.

## Minutes of the Meeting of the Births and Deaths Committee <orig>لجنة المواليد والوفيات</orig> in its Session
No. 2025/13 held on 27/04/2025

After reviewing the requests submitted for amending data in the birth and death records, it was decided to make the amendment listed below in the Official Gazette (Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>). If the committee does not receive any objection within fifteen days from the date of publication of this announcement, the amendment will be made in the records, and birth or death certificates will be issued according to the following amendment:

The Births and Deaths Committee <orig>لجنة المواليد والوفيات</orig>, stipulated in Article 15 of Law No. 69/36 and formed by Ministerial Resolution No. 2021/1650, met.
*   Mr. / Director of the Central Registry Department for Births and Deaths <orig>إدارة السجل المركزي للمواليد والوفيات</orig> - Chairman
*   Dr. / Head of the General Medical Council <orig>المجلس الطبي العام</orig> - Member
*   Mr. / Head of the Research and Opinion Department <orig>قسم البحوث والرأي</orig> - Member
*   Mr. / Head of the Registration Department <orig>قسم القيد</orig> - Member
*   Mr. / Head of the Deaths Department <orig>قسم الوفيات</orig> - Member
*   Mr. / Legal Researcher <orig>الباحث القانوني</orig> - Member
*   Mr. / Head of the Records Department <orig>قسم السجلات</orig> - Member

Ms. Alia Al-Saffar <orig>علياء الصفار</orig> performed the duties of the Committee's Secretary.
The Committee reviewed requests from No. (171) to No. (186) in the attached list concerning the amendment of data in birth and death records for requests regarding omitted birth and death registrations. After its review and verification of the completeness of documents and records, the Committee decided to announce the amendments and requests in the Official Gazette (Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>) in two consecutive issues, so that if the legal period (fifteen days) expires and no one objects to the presentation of the amendments in the registers, birth and death certificates will be issued.

President of the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig>

Announcement of the Public Auction Sale of Two Properties
The Clerk's Office <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> of the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> announces the public auction sale of the two properties described below, on Monday, 23/6/2025 AD, in Hall 5 - Eighth Floor - at the New Palace of Justice <orig>قصر العدل الجديد</orig> at 7:00 AM, in execution of the court judgment issued in lawsuit No. 1/2023 Sales/1 <orig>بيوع/1</orig>.
Filed by:
1- Rasmiya Saleh Mohammed Jumaa <orig>رسميه صالح محمد جمعه</orig>.
2- Nawaf Ali Saleh Al-Sharqawi <orig>نواف على صالح الشرقاوي</orig>.
3- Rana Ali Saleh Al-Sharqawi <orig>رنا على صالح الشرقاوي</orig>.
4- Saleh Ali Saleh Al-Sharqawi <orig>صالح على صالح الشرقاوي</orig>.
5- Jarrah Ali Saleh Al-Sharqawi <orig>جراح على صالح الشرقاوي</orig>.
6- Shaima Ali Saleh Al-Sharqawi <orig>شيماء على صالح الشرقاوي</orig>.
7- Asmaa Ali Saleh Al-Sharqawi <orig>أسماء على صالح الشرقاوي</orig>.
8- Rasha Ali Saleh Al-Sharqawi <orig>رشا على صالح الشرقاوي</orig>.
Against:
1- Badriya Saleh Mohammed Jumaa <orig>بدرية صالح محمد جمعه</orig>.
2- Undersecretary of the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig> for Real Estate Registration Affairs <orig>شئون التسجيل العقاري</orig>, in his capacity.
Description of the First Property: (According to the attached Certificate of Description)
1- Property with document No. 1971/516, located in Hawally <orig>حولي</orig> area - Plot No. 10 currently, and formerly 5 - Block No. 122 - from plan No. M/30554 currently, and formerly M/10256, with an area of 765 m², to be sold by public auction at a base price of (K.D. 1,110,000) One Million One Hundred Ten Thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>.
** According to the Certificate of Description:
- Violations exist in the property, namely:
1- Construction of a roof floor on the rooftop. 2- An extension exists in the annex. 3- Minor construction on the ground floor. 4- Construction and closure of major terraces on the ground floor. 5- The property is abandoned and contains debris.
** According to the Expert's Report:
The property in dispute is a residential building located in Hawally <orig>حولي</orig> area - Block 11 - Street 165. Plot 10/122, automated address number 90222263. The inspection at the time was as follows: -
1. The property in dispute conforms in terms of general and specific specifications, boundaries, and document No. 1970/516, with an area of 765 m².
2. The property in dispute is an investment residential building overlooking one street, bordered by neighbors on three sides, and its exterior cladding is limestone.
3. It consists of a ground floor, first floor, second floor, rooftop, annex, and a courtyard surrounding the building.
4. The ground floor consists of four apartments, each containing 2 rooms + a hall + a bathroom.
5. The first and second floors are identical in specifications to the ground floor.
6. The rooftop consists of 12 rooms and 6 bathrooms.
7. The annex consists of a storage room, a room and a hall with a separate entrance, and another room and a hall with a separate entrance.
8. Air conditioning is window units.
9. The flooring is tile.

At a base price of K.D. 2,697,300 (Two Million Six Hundred Ninety-Seven Thousand Three Hundred Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>).
** The Certificate of Description states that the property is an investment residence consisting of a basement + ground floor + first floor + second floor + (3-13) repeated floors + 14 + 15 and a rooftop, noting that the property is abandoned and closed.
** According to the Expert's Report
On 22/9/2024, we moved to the Shaab Al-Bahri <orig>الشعب البحري</orig> area, Plot 39, Block 8, in the presence and guidance of both the plaintiff's agent and the agents of the sixth and seventh defendants, and accompanied by the study expert Mr. Faisal Al-Sharhan <orig>فيصل الشرهان</orig>. The remaining defendants failed to attend. The inspection was conducted as follows:
1- The disputed property is an investment residential building located at the corner of two streets, Al-Dhahabi Street <orig>شارع الذهبي</orig> and Isa bin Salman Al Khalifa Street <orig>شارع عيسى بن سلمان آل خليفة</orig>, bordered by a neighbor on one side and a side plaza on the other.
2- The building's facade is Sigma, blue and white, and is in a modern state of construction.
3- The attending parties stated that they were unable to allow the expert to inspect the property from the inside. Therefore, the expert and the study expert sufficed with an external inspection and descriptions according to Certificate of Description No. 9319/2024, submitted by the plaintiff's agent and agreed upon by the plaintiff's agent and the agents of the sixth and seventh defendants.
4- According to the Certificate of Description, the property consists of a basement, ground floor, first floor, second floor, repeated floors from 3 to 13, and floors 14 and 15, and a rooftop.
5- The property has an area of 1173.5 m² according to its document No. 5531/2015.
6- The inspection revealed that the property is abandoned and closed.
7- The study expert reviewed the property specifications, and we presented the Certificate of Description and the document, in preparation for estimating the value of the property (land and building).
8- Photographic images of the property were taken as follows:

Secondly: Auction Terms:
Firstly: The auction shall commence at the base price indicated for the property. Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by means of certified checks from the drawee bank or by means of a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> of the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Secondly: The bidder whose offer is approved by the judge must deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees at the time of the sale session.
Thirdly: If the bidder whose offer was approved fails to deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the bidding will be reopened at their expense in the same session, based on the price at which the sale was previously awarded.
Fourthly: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction shall be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by the deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the bidding shall be reopened in the same session based on this new price.
Fifthly: If the initial bidder fails to deposit the full price in the subsequent session and no one comes forward to bid with a ten percent increase, the bidding shall be immediately reopened at their expense based on the price at which it was awarded to them in the previous session. No offer in this session shall be considered valid unless accompanied by a deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixthly: In all cases, the successful bidder shall bear the transfer and registration fees for ownership, enforcement procedure expenses amounting to K.D. 200, legal fees, and the cost and expenses of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventhly: This announcement is published in application of the law, and those directly involved in the sale procedures are responsible for them, without the Clerk's Office <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> of the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any responsibility.
Eighthly: The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property with an inspection that negates ignorance.
Notice: 1- This sale announcement shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The auction award judgment is appealable within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.

Secondly: Auction Conditions:
First: The auction shall commence with a base price of (K.D. 750,000) seven hundred and fifty thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>. Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of the price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Second: The bidder whose offer is approved by the judge must deposit, at the time of the sale session, the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees.
Third: If the bidder whose offer was approved fails to deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the bidding shall be reopened at their expense in the same session based on the price at which the sale was previously awarded.
Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction shall be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by the deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the bidding shall be reopened in the same session based on this new price.
Fifth: If the initial bidder fails to deposit the full price in the subsequent session, and no one comes forward to bid with a ten percent increase, the bidding shall immediately be reopened at their expense based on the price at which it was previously awarded to them in the preceding session. In this session, no offer not accompanied by the deposit of its full value shall be considered. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixth: In all cases, the successful bidder shall bear the transfer and registration fees for ownership, enforcement procedure expenses amounting to K.D. 200, legal and expert fees, and advertising and publication costs for the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventh: This announcement is published in accordance with the law, and those directly involved in the sale procedures are responsible for them, without the Clerk's Office <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> of the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any responsibility.
Eighth: The successful bidder acknowledges having inspected the property in a manner that negates any ignorance of its condition.

3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states that "If the dispossessed owner resides in the property, they shall remain in it as a tenant by operation of law, and the successful bidder shall be obligated to draw up a lease contract in their favor at a fair market rent."

The disputed property located in Jleeb Al-Shuyoukh <orig>جليب الشيوخ</orig> area, Block 2, Mohammed Ibn Al-Qasim <orig>محمد ابن القاسم</orig> Street, Plot No. 248, was inspected as follows:

- The property subject of the lawsuit holds document number 1978/808 and an area of 1264 m². A subsequent document number 1982/1751 was issued for it.
- The property subject of the lawsuit is an old investment and commercial residence, located on a corner overlooking a main street, an internal street, and a side alley. It is bordered by neighbors to the north and is opposite the Commercial Bank <orig>البنك التجاري</orig> and Kuwait International Bank <orig>بنك الكويت الدولي</orig>. The exterior cladding is Jordanian stone and limestone bricks, and its external facades are covered with plaster.

He was also unable to describe the internal components of the property as he possessed no information about its details.

Secondly: Auction Terms and Conditions:
Firstly: The auction shall start at the base price. Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Secondly: The bidder whose offer is approved by the judge must deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees at the time of the sale session.
Thirdly: If the bidder whose offer was approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the bidding will be reopened at their expense in the same session based on the price at which the sale was initially awarded.
Fourthly: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction shall be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by the deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the bidding will be reopened in the same session based on this new price.
Fifthly: If the first bidder fails to deposit the full price in the subsequent session and no one comes forward to bid with a ten percent increase, the bidding will immediately be reopened at their expense based on the price at which it was awarded to them in the previous session. No bid in this session will be considered unless accompanied by a deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixthly: In all cases, the successful bidder shall bear the transfer and registration fees for ownership, the expenses of enforcement procedures amounting to 200 K.D. <orig>د.ك</orig>, legal and expert fees, and the costs of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventhly: This announcement is published in accordance with the law, and those directly involved in the sale procedures are responsible for them, without the Clerk's Office <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> of the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any responsibility.
Eighthly: The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property with an inspection that negates ignorance.
Notice:
1- This sale announcement shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The auction award judgment is appealable within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states that "If the dispossessed owner resides in the property, they shall remain in it as a tenant by force of law, and the successful bidder shall be obliged to draw up a lease contract in their favor at a fair market rent."
President of the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig>

The expert matched the ownership deeds of the disputed property with the reality and found a discrepancy between the property parcel number stated in document No. 2017/4482 and the address indicated by the plaintiff's agent. The plaintiff's agent stated that the reason for this is that Parcel 474 is a result of the subdivision of Parcel No. 339, according to the notes in the map issued by the Survey Department <orig>إدارة المساحة</orig> of Kuwait Municipality <orig>بلدية الكويت</orig> and submitted as part of the plaintiff's document portfolio on 9/9/2024.
The expert found that the disputed property overlooks the intersection of Riyadh Street <orig>شارع الرياض</orig> and the Fourth Ring Road <orig>الدائري الرابع</orig> from the east and northeast, and overlooks Avenue No. 3 from the southwest, and is bordered by neighbors from the south and northwest, and is clad in stone.
The defendant's agent enabled the expert to enter and inspect, where it was found that the disputed property is an independent house for private residence and does not generate any income, with the following details:
1. The lower floor at avenue level: consists of two parts; the first includes a foyer + reception room + preparatory kitchen + laundry room + storage room + maid's room and its bathroom, while the second part includes car parks + 2 maid's rooms and their bathrooms + preparatory kitchen + living room + guest bathroom.
2. The ground floor at Riyadh Street <orig>شارع الرياض</orig> level: main foyer + 3 halls + dining room + main kitchen + preparatory kitchen + room / entrance + bathroom and washbasins.
3. The first floor: 3 bedrooms with a bathroom for each + preparatory kitchen + dining room + living room + large master bedroom suite with a dressing room, bathroom, and washbasins, and the suite has been renovated + balcony.
4. The second floor: 3 bedrooms with a bathroom for each + laundry room + air conditioning and elevator service rooms.

Secondly: Auction Conditions:
Firstly: The auction shall start with a base price of 2,610,000 K.D. (Two Million Six Hundred Ten Thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>), and participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of the price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> of the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Secondly: Whoever's bid is approved by the judge must deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees at the time of the sale session.
Thirdly: If the approved bidder does not deposit the full price, they must deposit one-fifth of the price.

Secondly: The bidder whose offer is approved by the judge must deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees upon the conclusion of the sale session.
Thirdly: If the bidder whose offer was approved fails to deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the bidding will be reopened at their expense in the same session, based on the price at which the sale was previously awarded.
Fourthly: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction shall be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by a full deposit for the auction in that session.
