### Property Description:
As stated in the Municipality's property description certificate.
The property was entered, and its condition was found to be completely abandoned, with open pipes, and unsuitable for habitation.
An undivided share of 50% in the property under document number 1993/4718 located in Bayan <orig>بيان</orig> area – Plot No. (142), Block No. (12), Plan M / 33355 – of its total area of 300m2, by public auction with a basic price of K.D. 139,500 (one hundred thirty-nine thousand five hundred Kuwaiti Dinars) for the offered share.

** It was stated in the description certificate that the property is a private residence consisting of a ground floor, first floor, and an annex.
** And according to the expert's report
On 9/9/2024, the expert team moved to the dispute site located in Bayan <orig>بيان</orig> area - Block 12 – Street 1 – Plot 142, House 8, Automated Number 12042662. Document No. 1993/4718 with an area of 300 m2. This was in the presence and guidance of the plaintiffs' agent, while the remaining defendants were absent despite proper notification. Mr. Nasser Hajji Badhan Al-Mutairi <orig>ناصر حجي بدهان المطيري</orig>, the knowledge expert, was present, and the inspection was carried out as follows:
1. The disputed property is an old-built house located on a single street, bordered by neighbors on the right and left.
2. We knocked on the door, but no one opened it, as the property was found to be closed. Therefore, the expert team could not determine whether the disputed property is independent or not.
3. The knowledge expert stated that he could estimate the value of the property (land and building) from the outside. Accordingly, the property was inspected from the outside, and he could not estimate the building values due to the inability to inspect the property's components.
4. The expert team found that the property consists of a ground floor, a first floor, and an annex in the yard.
5. The expert team took photographs of the property.
Mr. Nasser Hajji Badhan Al-Mutairi <orig>ناصر حجي بدهان المطيري</orig>, the knowledge expert, inspected the property in preparation for estimating the value of the land and buildings according to prevailing market prices.

### Second: Auction Terms and Conditions:
First: The auction shall commence at the basic price indicated for the property. Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Second: The bidder whose offer is approved by the judge must deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees at the time of the sale session.
Third: If the bidder whose offer was approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the bidding will be reopened at their expense in the same session based on the price at which the sale was previously awarded.
Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction shall be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by the deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the bidding shall be reopened in the same session based on this new price.
Fifth: If the initial bidder fails to deposit the full price in the subsequent session and no one comes forward with a ten percent increase, the bidding shall be immediately reopened at their expense based on the price at which it was awarded to them in the previous session. In this session, no offer not accompanied by the deposit of its full value shall be considered. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixth: In all cases, the successful bidder shall bear the transfer and registration fees for ownership, the expenses of enforcement procedures amounting to K.D. 200, legal and expert fees, and the costs of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.
Seventh: This announcement shall be published in accordance with the law, and those directly involved in the sale procedures shall do so under their responsibility, without the Clerk's Office <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> of the Court of First Instance <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any liability.
Eighth: The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property with an inspection that negates ignorance.

### Notice:
1. This sale announcement shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2. The auction award judgment is appealable within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3. The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states that "If the dispossessed owner is residing in the property, they shall remain in it as a tenant by operation of law, and the successful bidder shall be obligated to draw up a lease contract in their favor at a fair market rent."

Inspection:
On 25/5/2022, the expert <orig>الخبرة</orig> moved to the disputed property <orig>عين النزاع</orig> located in Abdullah Al-Salem <orig>عبدالله السالم</orig> area, Block 2, Street 21, Plot 20, House 11, Automated Number 10412594, in the presence and guidance of the plaintiff <orig>المدعية</orig> in person, and with the defendants <orig>المدعى عليهم</orig> or their representatives failing to attend, and in the presence of Mr. Expert of Knowledge / Khalid Al-Harbawi <orig>خالد الحرباوي</orig>. The inspection was carried out as follows:
1- The expert knocked on the door, but no one opened it, as the plaintiff stated that the property was in the possession of the first defendant.
2- The expert inspected the property from the outside, which is a plot overlooking two streets (front and back) <orig>بطن وظهر</orig>, an internal street and a public street (Maghreb Road <orig>طريق المغرب</orig>), with a setback <orig>ارتداد</orig> and an open area, with a total area of 1000 m².
3- The plaintiff stated that the property consists of a basement covering half of the property, a ground floor, and a first floor.
4- The property is clad with stone and tiles.
Second: Auction Terms:
First: The auction shall start with a base price <orig>الثمن الأساسي</orig> of KWD 2,025,000 (Two Million and Twenty-Five Thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>). Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Second: The bidder whose offer is approved by the judge must deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees at the time of the sale session.
Third: If the bidder whose offer was approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price, otherwise the bidding will be reopened at their expense <orig>على ذمته</orig> in the same session based on the price at which the sale was previously awarded.
Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction will be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session willing to purchase with a ten percent increase <orig>بزيادة العشر</orig>, accompanied by the deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the bidding will be reopened in the same session based on this new price.
Fifth: If the first bidder fails to deposit the full price in the subsequent session and no one comes forward to bid with a ten percent increase, the bidding will be immediately reopened at their expense <orig>على ذمته</orig> based on the price at which it was previously awarded to them in the previous session. No offer in this session will be considered unless accompanied by a deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder <orig>المزايد المتخلف</orig> shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixth: The successful bidder <orig>الراسي عليه المزاد</orig> shall, in all cases, bear the transfer and registration fees for ownership, with a base amount of KWD 333,000 (Three Hundred and Thirty Thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>).

6- Mr. Expert of Knowledge <orig>خبير الدراية</orig> took the necessary notes to assess the value of the disputed property <orig>عقار النزاع</orig> and the value of the usufruct <orig>مقابل الانتفاع</orig>, and submitted a special report regarding this.
And enforcement procedure expenses amounting to KWD 200, and legal and expert fees, and expenses for advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.

The Clerk's Office <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> of the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> announces the public auction of the property described below, on Wednesday, 18/6/2025 AD - Hall 5 - on the eighth floor of the New Palace of Justice <orig>قصر العدل الجديد</orig> at 9:00 AM - in execution of the court judgment issued in lawsuit No. 640/2023 Sales 2.
Filed by:
Najm Abdullah Abdulaziz Al-Failakawi <orig>نجم عبدالله عبدالعزيز الفيلكاوي</orig>
Against:
1- Dhikrayat Mubarak Melihan Al-Tuwaihi <orig>ذكريات مبارك مليحان الطويحي</orig>.
2- Director General of Kuwait Credit Bank <orig>بنك الائتمان الكويتي</orig> in his capacity as the former Savings and Credit Bank <orig>بنك الادخار والتسليف</orig>.
3- Undersecretary of the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig> for Real Estate Documentation Affairs <orig>شئون التوثيق العقاري</orig> in his capacity.
Property Description: As stated in the Municipality's <orig>البلدية</orig> description certificate.
- Property document No. 2369/2009, located in Al-Dhaher <orig>الظهر</orig> area - Plot No. 41 - Piece No. 2 - Plan M 36923 - with an area of 278.92m², by public auction with a basic price of 222,750 K.D. (Two hundred twenty-two thousand seven hundred fifty Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>).
Remarks: After inspecting the property, it was found to be a private residence consisting of a ground floor, first floor, and a roof. There are violations where the owner has encroached towards the street by an area of 27.2 square meters on the ground floor and 39.44 square meters on the first floor, with no building permit. There is also full encroachment on the first floor towards the neighbor. There is a licensed structure on the ground floor with a Kirby roof <orig>سقف كيربي</orig> of 5.29m² at the rear, and an unlicensed structure on the ground floor of 5.29m² at the rear.
** And according to the expert's report
The disputed property <orig>عين النزاع</orig> located in Al-Dhaher <orig>الظهر</orig> area - Piece 2 - Street 3 - Avenue 21 - House 1 - Document No. 41 - Automated Address Number 91057749 at the time of inspection, as follows:
1. The disputed property <orig>العقار محل النزاع</orig> has an area of 278.92m² according to document No. 2369 registered on 17/2/2009.
2. The disputed property <orig>العقار محل النزاع</orig> is a government house <orig>بيت حكومي</orig> located at the corner of two streets with a shared back courtyard and one neighbor on one side. The exterior cladding is beige stone, and it has 8 shaded parking spaces.
3. The property consists of a ground floor, a first floor, and a roof, and has 3 entrances: a main entrance, a separate diwaniya <orig>ديوانية</orig> entrance, and a side entrance, with the following details:
a- The ground floor consists of a living room with its bathroom + bedrooms + its bathroom + kitchen + maid's room.
b- An annex consisting of a room with its bathroom + a diwaniya <orig>ديوانية</orig> with its bathroom.
c- The first floor consists of 3 bedrooms + a living room + a bathroom + a main kitchen.
d- The roof has a storage room and an air conditioning unit space.
4. Air conditioning units.
5. The first defendant stated that she resides on the first floor, while no one resides on the ground floor.
Second: Auction Conditions:
First: The auction shall start at the basic price indicated for the property. Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of the price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> of the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Second: Whoever's bid is approved by the judge must deposit, at the time of the sale session, the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees.
Third: If the bidder whose bid was approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price, otherwise the bidding will be reopened at their expense in the same session based on the price at which the sale was awarded.
Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction shall be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, calculated by depositing the full auction price. In this case, the bidding shall be reopened in the same session based on this new price.
Fifth: If the first bidder fails to deposit the full price in the subsequent session and no one comes forward to bid with the ten percent increase, the bidding shall be immediately reopened at their expense based on the price at which it was awarded to them in the previous session. No bid in this session shall be considered valid unless accompanied by a deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
Sixth: In all cases, the successful bidder <orig>الراسي عليه المزاد</orig> shall bear the transfer and registration fees for ownership, enforcement procedure expenses amounting to 200 K.D., and legal and expert fees.
Seventh: This announcement shall be published in accordance with the law, and those directly involved in the sale procedures shall do so at their own responsibility, without the Clerk's Office <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig>

Announcement
The Public Authority for Applied Education and Training <orig>الهيئة العامة للتعليم التطبيقي والتدريب</orig> announces the publication of the announcement regarding the re-issuance of Practice No. PA/SA.M/2024-2025 concerning agricultural maintenance for the Third Area – Al-Ardiya <orig>العارضية</orig> at the Public Authority for Applied Education and Training <orig>الهيئة العامة للتعليم التطبيقي والتدريب</orig>, according to the terms and specifications stated in the practice documents.
Companies and institutions wishing to participate in this practice must visit the Public Authority for Applied Education and Training <orig>الهيئة العامة للتعليم التطبيقي والتدريب</orig> website (www.Paaet.edu.Kw) to purchase the practice bid, which is listed under electronic services (general services). for the Auction Sale Committee <orig>لجنة البيع بالمزاد</orig> to sell the goods in one lot or several lots, depending on the sales conditions.
2. The successful bidder <orig>الراسي عليه المزاد</orig> shall bear a brokerage commission <orig>عمولة دلالة</orig> of 2% of the sale price.
3. The successful bidder <orig>الراسي عليه المزاد</orig> must pay the value of the goods only via K-net <orig>الكي-نت</orig>, according to the assessment of the Auction Sale Committee <orig>لجنة البيع بالمزاد</orig>.
4. The successful bidder <orig>الراسي عليه المزاد</orig> must remove the goods from the headquarters of the Bait Al-Mal <orig>بيت المال</orig> Control Department <orig>مراقبة بيت المال</orig> urgently and within 5 (five) to 7 (seven) days after the auction is awarded to them. Otherwise, any goods will be seized and sold in the next auction if the successful bidder <orig>من رسا عليه المزاد</orig> fails to remove them within the specified period.
5. No buyer to whom the goods have been awarded is permitted to assign or resell them to a third party until after they have been removed from the headquarters of the Bait Al-Mal <orig>بيت المال</orig> Control Department <orig>مراقبة بيت المال</orig> affiliated with the Administration <orig>الإدارة</orig>.
6. If the goods are not sold for any reason in the auction, the Committee <orig>للجنة</orig> has the right to offer them for sale in the subsequent auction.
7. The Administration <orig>للإدارة</orig> has the right to stop, postpone, or re-schedule the sale at another time if an appropriate price is not obtained or for any reasons it deems contrary to its interest.
8. The Auction Sale Committee <orig>لجنة البيع بالمزاد</orig> may cancel or postpone the auction for any reason it deems appropriate.
9. Since the goods will be sold as is, bidders must inspect them to ascertain the condition, quality, and type of these goods located at the aforementioned address during the auction sale.
10. In the event that the successful bidder <orig>الراسي عليه</orig> refrains from paying the sale price or part thereof, the General Administration of Customs <orig>الإدارة العامة للجمارك</orig> has the right to resell the goods at their expense. If the price does not reach the amount at which the auction was initially awarded, they shall be obligated to pay the difference. In this case, the Administration <orig>للإدارة</orig> has the right to bar them from participating in any future auction.
11. The Administration <orig>الإدارة</orig> is not responsible for any action or use of the sold goods that violates the prevailing laws and legislations.
12. This sale is conducted in accordance with the provisions of Law No. 10 of 2003 regarding the Unified Customs System <orig>النظام الموحد للجمارك</orig> and its regulating decisions.

# Public Anti-Corruption Authority / Nazaha <orig>الهيئة العامة لمكافحة الفساد</orig>
## Announcement
The Public Anti-Corruption Authority / Nazaha <orig>الهيئة العامة لمكافحة الفساد</orig> announces the offering of Practice No. (01 - 2025/2026) regarding the renewal of licenses for the security information monitoring and analysis system, maintenance of intrusion prevention system devices, and provision of technical support.
Companies wishing to participate can obtain the documents from the Financial Affairs Department <orig>إدارة الشئون المالية</orig> – Ground Floor of the Public Anti-Corruption Authority / Nazaha <orig>الهيئة العامة لمكافحة الفساد</orig> building, Plot (2) Annex (1), during official working hours starting from Sunday, 2025/05/25, for a non-refundable fee of (75 K.D. <orig>د.ك.</orig>) (only seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>ديناراً كويتياً</orig>).
Bids shall be submitted to the headquarters of the Public Anti-Corruption Authority / Nazaha <orig>الهيئة العامة لمكافحة الفساد</orig> located in Al-Shamiya <orig>الشامية</orig>, accompanied by an initial security deposit of (2000 K.D. <orig>د.ك.</orig>) in the form of an unconditional letter of guarantee or certified check issued by one of the accredited local banks in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>. It should be valid for the entire duration of the offer, and offers shall be valid for (90) ninety days from the date of opening their envelopes. Bids must be placed inside a single envelope, sealed with red wax, and the bid envelope must be addressed externally to the Public Anti-Corruption Authority / Nazaha <orig>الهيئة العامة لمكافحة الفساد</orig>, with the subject mentioned as indicated above, while avoiding the name of the bidder or any indication thereof. The deadline for submitting bids is 1:00 PM on Tuesday, 2025/06/10.
All practitioners participating in this practice must attend the preliminary meeting, which will be held at 10:00 AM on Sunday, 2025/06/01, at the headquarters of the Public Anti-Corruption Authority / Nazaha <orig>الهيئة العامة لمكافحة الفساد</orig> – Al-Shamiya <orig>الشامية</orig>. The practitioner shall be considered bound by what is stated in the meeting minutes and the compilation of documents for this practice, whether they attended this meeting or not.
Secretary General <orig>الأمين العام</orig>

Regarding the request for the release of the company's bank guarantees <orig>الكفالات المصرفية</orig> deposited with the Municipality <orig>البلدية</orig> in consideration of its classification.

Based on Article (19) of Municipality Resolution No. (2009/161) <orig>قرار البلدية رقم (2009/161)</orig> concerning the classification, licensing, and registration of building and demolition contractors <orig>مقاولي أعمال البناء والهدم</orig> in Kuwait Municipality <orig>بلدية الكويت</orig>, which stipulates that a contractor may submit a request to the Municipality <orig>البلدية</orig> to cancel their registration before its expiry or to cancel the classification, and the committee <orig>اللجنة</orig> stipulated in Article One of this regulation <orig>اللائحة</orig> may issue its decision to that effect after fulfilling the following two conditions:
1. The contractor has completed all contracted works.
2. (15) fifteen days have passed from the date of publishing this request in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

The cancellation of the license <orig>الترخيص</orig> or registration <orig>التسجيل</orig> entails the return of the bank guarantee <orig>الكفالة المصرفية</orig> submitted by the contractor, taking into account the last paragraph of Article (10) of this resolution.
Accordingly, the Municipality <orig>البلدية</orig> appeals to anyone who has any claims <orig>مطالبات</orig> against the aforementioned contractor regarding building contracting agreements <orig>عقود مقاولات البناء</orig> concluded between them that have not yet been completed, or judicial attachments <orig>حجوزات قضائية</orig> in their favor due to violating contracting works <orig>أعمال مقاولات مخالفة</orig> or dues arising from the contracting agreement <orig>عقد المقاولة</orig>, to review the Contractors Department <orig>قسم المقاولين</orig> in the Engineering Systems Department <orig>إدارة الأنظمة الهندسية</orig> within a maximum period of fifteen days from this date. The Municipality <orig>البلدية</orig> will not consider any claims submitted after the prescribed period.

Director General of the Municipality <orig>مدير عام البلدية</orig>

Kuwait Institute for Scientific Research <orig>معهد الكويت للأبحاث العلمية</orig> announces the opening of registration for companies as suppliers for the fiscal year 2025/2026.
Companies / establishments wishing to be listed in the suppliers' register of Kuwait Institute for Scientific Research <orig>معهد الكويت للأبحاث العلمية</orig> should refer to the Procurement and Stores Department – Purchase Requests Section at the Institute's main headquarters in Shuwaikh <orig>الشويخ</orig> (Administrative Building – Third Floor) to obtain registration or renewal applications from the Institute or to follow the Institute's website <<__Procurement and Stores__>> – Registration Form or Company Data Renewal Form.

11. Registration with the Ministry of Communications <orig>وزارة المواصلات</orig> for companies specializing in communication devices.
